description:
First, the interior design... that starts it out... the fixtures, the oversized metal coffee machine, all of it.... a great start... you meet your server.. so very friendly.... in our case, his list of favorites was pretty much the menu, depending on his mood that day.... they take your order, no note pad... your tri-tip sandwich arrives.... you slather some horseradish on it.... sooooo good.... crispy fries or a fresh salad.... if only I would try something else there... like my friends with the roasted chicken on top of roasted Brussels sprouts.... or other great things...
.... one of these days.... I still have yet to peruse the dessert menu.... again... some day... but looking forward to it.....

Make sure to use an app like OpenTable to make a reservation..... it's a popular place...
author: Joe V.

description:
I was in charge of finding a spot to have a group work dinner around the Union Square/Moscone area. After looking up a couple of options, I settled on Per Diem. They require a credit card on file for parties of 6 or more, which was a bit annoying, but understandable. It's $20 per person for no shows or any other changes.

Set up took longer than we had expected, so I called to change our reservation from 6pm to 7pm. They mentioned that there would be a small charge for this and any no-shows. That's fine, it was our bad.

The bar area is very loud, but tables on the upper level are very quiet and is a really great place to have a large group dinner.

Appetizers were tasty - we split the burrata and fried carrots. We all had their mushroom pasta, which was phenomenal. Dessert was the apple cobbler and key lime pie. Everything tasted amazing and service was on point and attentive.

I think I made an excellent choice and would not hesitate to pick Per Diem again.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Let me preface it by saying I rarely leave any kind of yelp of you unless I really have to. the one star was for the bus boy and the bartender Arnie, who eventually took over our table because we requested that we did not have the waitress wait on us anymore because her service sucked. The food was average...the pizza margarita look like it came from the microwave of a Stouffers Pizza however the surf and turf was on point. The meatballs had too much bread tonight. They do not make their dessert in house Which is why we opted for the salted caramel ice cream which by the way, was scrumptious.

My bone of contention was with the initial wait staff.. We had a blonde waitress finally check on us 25 minutes after we sat down. Please note we were seated at the front section of the restaurant. She took our order and apologized for the wine being late which took another 15 minutes to get to us. After about 45 minutes of not receiving our food order, I spoke to the host,  who I was pleasant,

The next thing I know, we have a brunette waitress come try table she did not apologize once for our food not even being here and she had the audacity to say that the other service person was off and "she was not obligated to service us any longer" since she was off the clock. 

IDGAF!!!! Am I obligated to pay the 4% health service charge for all San Francisco employees? Yes. therefore you are obligated to serve me and I don't care who services me but somebody better.

Listen, if the table next to us told you to check on us because they sat down after us and they received their food before us and we have not received our appetizer that should tell you something. 

I have been in the service industry for a long time. I understand if you are transitioning wait staff. There is a way to politely say, " excuse me my shift is done please close out with me...so and so will be servicing you tonight." I would have gladly tipped you out and transfer the remaining balance of our meal to the new person. That never happened tonight and I'm highly disappointed. 

I have been here on three separate occasions and never once have experienced the abhorrent and disgusting service that I received tonight.

Blondie, if your shift is done your shift is done. Trust me I get it. But do not leave your guests in the dark by not transferring over the tab to the new server and then proceed to socialize with the host for the next 45 minutes. We don't know what's up and we are waiting for our food!!! We work a long ass day and at the end of the day we want to be taken care of and we want to spend our money.

the bartender that waited on us and was very nice and we gave him a very generous tip because he deserved it and the bus boys did too!!! 

 I hope these two wait people get a reprimand and learn their lesson., There are many restaurants in San Francisco where we could spend our hard earned money with and have 100% more enjoyable time with.
author: Cal K.

description:
Came here after work with a friend for some wine and cheese. We had a reservation, thankfully, because this place is crowded!

Very nice, dimly lit interior. Beautiful cheese board and good red wine. There are lots of menu options for food and drinks as well!

I'd come back here due to it's ambiance and convenient location
author: Kaitlynn L.

description:
I got off work early for the holiday weekend. What does that mean? Happy hour! I arrived first on Friday, May 25th a little after 4pm. No reservation as I don't think they take them for HH. Managed to find a small round table in the front by the window. One of the boys joined me shortly after and the other about an hour later.

Happy Hour: served 4pm to 6pm
*Glass of Wine - bartender's selection: sparkling, white, red ($8)
*Bottle of Wine Special - bartender's selection: white, red ($30)
*Standard & Pours: one shot, one beer ($9) x3

I was by myself for a good 20 mins, so I just nursed a glass of HH bubbly. I never saw the bottle, but was told it was a prosecco. When one of the boys joined me, we took part in the wine bottle special. It was National Wine Day after all. The red bottle was Chronic Cellars Suite Petite, so I believe a petite sirah. When I found out the HH shot was a four roses (I think bourbon), I decided to take part. I think our server said the beer was a racer ipa. I just took a sip and pawned it off on the boys. (I'm not a huge beer person.)

*Lobster Fries ($18)
*Steamed Mussels: PEI mussels, garlic & white wine sauce, rustic toast ($13)
*Rustic Meatballs: bellwether farms ricotta toast, san marzano tomato sauce, parmigiano, micro basil ($13)
*Burrata Margarita Flatbread: tomato sauce, fresh basil, olive oil ($16)
*Talisker 18 Year, Isle of Skye ($18) x2
*Tomintoul 16 Year, Highland ($15)

They don't have HH food specials, so we just ordered from their Afternoon Delights menu since this was basically our dinner. I adored the lobster fries. Came topped with a good amount of lobster. And that sauce. So comforting and savory. The mussels were also good. Plump and tender. We all decided to end HH with a scotch whisky. I got the Talisker as I thought it was a good deal. $1 per year is typically a great deal when it's an 18 year, right?

Fun place for HH. I'd definitely come back for those fries and a bottle of wine.
author: Elena N.

description:
Per Diem is located on Sutter Street, we parked in the public lot on Stockton/Shutter. We paid about $8 for about 3 or 4 hours. 

[[ Charcuterie $12 ]] https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/per-diem-san-francisco?select=vOFZ6Gny-_7L1OVeuIE3YA The charcuterie came with 3 selections of meat, a few pickles, walnut bread crostini, and whole grain mustard. Overall, I thought this appetizer was alright. I would have preferred softer crackers or bread instead of the walnut crostini. 

[[ Burrata Tartine $12 ]] https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/per-diem-san-francisco?select=Yy5T8zrQTpms74KHnRuqwA This was sweeter than I expected. I guess I shouldn't be surprised cause its served with honey, almonds and sea salt. Other places that I had Burrata was more savory than sweet.

[[ Wild Mushroom Pasta $20 ]] https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/per-diem-san-francisco?select=1sXhO-Acf_cBYQ9NO5UCfg I'm a huge fan of this pasta. I love the egg and truffle sauce used. However the portion was smaller than I expected.

[[ Squid Ink Linguini $26 ]] https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/per-diem-san-francisco?select=XwJWwywx2VuoyqSoBs97UQ  This pasta was king of dry. I only tried a couple bites but I was expecting more sauce on it. The prawns and scallop was cooked nicely. 

[[ Marquise Au Chocolate ]] https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/per-diem-san-francisco?select=Y4tYmO33oTlBirGMiuNADQ This chocolate dessert was delish but really rich. 

Overall, I had a good time. We ended up staying till closing just enjoying drinks after our meal and having a good conversation. The service was excellent but the food was just alright.
author: Ariana M.

description: This place is right in the heart of downtown, close to FiDi.....It has cozy interiors and dim lighting to set  a relaxing mood from noise around. The hostess was welcoming and the service was good. They allow reservations online too. I had a Chardonnay and the cheese trio. It was a good combination and there was right amount of variety with a hard cheese, a semi soft and slightly aromatic/pungent cheese. The marmalade and raisins provided the sweet balance with pecans offering the crunch.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
This place has pretty decent food and drinks but the wait staff could use some serious work. My date and I hung out at the bar while we waited for a table during busy dinner hours.  I ordered a well-made old fashioned and my date ordered the Falcon (which I cannot find on their current menu). The drinks and the friendly bartender entertained us while we waited. After about 15 minutes, the host called us over to let us know our table was ready and then quickly retracted her statement because she said that the party before us suddenly and inexplicably returned to our table. This was the first of a series of odd, innattentive occurences. For an appetizer, we ordered the barratta cheese with almonds, which was both delicious and sweet. 

For the main dish, we ordered the roasted chicken, which was nicely done but I got a thigh instead of a breast.  I had to wait until I was almost finished with my meal in order to get my wine, which I had ordered at the same time as the main. When my Chardonnay finally arrived, it went well with the chicken and the vegetables, which include spring peas and artichoke hearts.  At this point the waitress must have gone off duty or something because I had to wait a while for the check. 

I would be interested in returning but have to say it will not be anytime soon. There are just too many places around that also serve good food but are not lacking in customer service.
author: Robert M.

description:
Great lunch spot in the fidi! Went there for a company lunch last Friday after the Fourth of July

Atmosphere: So cute and fresh! Feels trendy and has a lot of natural light.

Food: I had the mozzarella sandwich - It was definitely good, but not amazing. I'd like to try more items next time.

Location: In the middle of everything, and tucked back on a quieter back street.
author: Michelle B.

description:
What a cool spot to go to lunch in the FiDi. 

Came here for a Holiday lunch with my co-workers and it was such a treat. 

The food here fits California cuisine to a T. 


To start, we ordered the burrata toast, avocado toast and meatballs as appetizers. Wasn't a big fan of the avocado toast cause it was mixed with lime and spicy peppers and reminded me of guacamole on toast than traditional avocado spread. 

The meatballs and and burrata toast were delectible! 

The lunch menu offers everything from pasta to sandwiches and salads. Whether you're a vegetarian or carnivore, it's guaranteed you'll find something that suits your palette. 

For an entree I ordered the wild mushroom pasta. I was caught off guard to see it came with an egg and arugula on top but this was a pleasant surprise. The mushrooms were soft and packed full of flavor and the pasta sauce was light and not too heavy for being white. 

Overall, the service was quick, attentive and friendly. The cuisine was delicious and visually pleasing. 

I would definitely recommend this place to people in the area and plan on coming back for dinner.
author: Ashley L.

description: Stopped here for dinner based on the good reviews. Promptly seated despite not having a reservation. We had good service even though our server was handling a lot of tables. The mussels were a really generous portion and delicious, and the short ribs were good as well.
author: David S.

description: Per the usual, the food is superb!  Love the ambiance and the great warm feeling it gives, the server was extremely nice and the chef fulfilled our tweaks in the order perfectly.  The meatball appetizer had great flavor and texture.. had to sop up the sauce w extra bread. The scallop and shrimp in the pasta dish was cooked to perfection. We are still talking about the chimichurri sauce on the steak to this day!  I asked for the salmon to be undercooked to rare and it was perfect!!!  I just wish the food came out faster... the wait was over 30 minutes. We've slowly slipped through 2 drinks, had 3 water refills and when the server finally checked with the kitchen, our food was brought out. The food wasn't hot, but was warm. I understand this is not fast food and delicious food takes time but the rest of my table was ready to leave.  Almost 100% Per Diem, almost.
author: J T.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco for my birthday with friends and decided on this restaurant for our last meal together. It was the perfect atmosphere for what we were going for, a bit dressed up yet still casual. We were immediately seated at the high top tables in the bar area with no reservation. 

We brought our own bottle from wine country and the corkage fee was $25. I had seen this restaurant on some list saying they didn't have a corkage fee, but I called ahead and asked so there were no surprises there. We ended up buying another bottle for $53.

Started off with the charcuterie and cheese appetizers. Good size to share the two between 4 people. The mustard served with the charcuterie had a big kick to it if you're into that kind of thing.

We all ordered different things for dinner. One steak and lobster, one strip steak, one mushroom pasta, and the squid ink linguine for myself. My vegetarian friend was still hungry after her meal. I want expecting the level of heat my linguine came with so I went easy on the noodles and ate all the seafood. The shrimp and scallops were enough to keep me satisfied. For dessert, we had the apple tart with caramel ice cream. It was so good! I wish I had a whole tub of that caramel ice cream.

Overall great experience enjoying a meal with friends.
author: Wannee P.

description:
Came to Per Diem a second time with friends for dinner, but unfortunately it did not live up to my first visit.

Burrata Margarita Flatbread -- I LOVE burrata, but this flatbread was just OK. I recommend the Smoked Bacon Flatbread over this one.

Roasted Tomato Soup -- I LOVE tomato soup, too. This soup was good, but unfortunately came out lukewarm, bordering cold for us. Appreciated the server splitting the soup for us, but wouldn't order again.

Rustic Meatballs -- meatballs weren't very special, but the tomato sauce was good.

Wild Mushroom Pasta -- underwhelming dish & the pasta was a way more al denta than I would prefer; wouldn't order again.

Steak & Lobster -- we asked for medium rare, but the steak came out more medium; thought the lobster was decent.

Roasted Brussels Sprouts -- nothing really stood out this time for me with this side.

I was particularly sad about their drinks being seasonal because I was REALLY looking forward to ordering the Billionaire Bramble. I had to settle with the Barbary Coastin' which was no where comparable. My friends ordered the Perfect Yen & thought it was an OK drink.

Overall, I may be a little hesitant to come back for another dining experience, but not completely deterred. Still plenty of other dishes to try, service is good, & provides a nice atmosphere. Can make reservations easily through Open Table!
author: Carol N.

description:
Recommendation: Good food for respectable prices. Super cool decoration. We had to wait 20 minutes after our reservation to be seated, but got compensated appetizers as a "sorry" gesture. I'd say you shouldn't go here if you're in a hurry, but it's worth visiting otherwise! 

I called at 3pm yesterday to make a reservation for lunch today. No pick-up. I called again at 5:30, during their dinner hours, and still nobody picked up. I left a message asking to make the reservation, but I don't think it happened. Later that night I booked a reservation through OpenTable, but it only allowed booking in half-hour increments. No 12:45 lunch reservation for us I guess, so I just went with 1pm instead, for a party of 6. No issues, I got the confirmation email and thought we were set. 

Come the day of the reservation, we go in at 12:55 for our 1pm reservation. They had us in the reservation list and told us we'd be seated shortly. We checked with the hostesses again at 1:10 and they said the people at the table were still finishing up. (After walking through the restaurant to our table, it was clear that there wasn't a whole bunch of seating for groups of 6.) At 1:15 we asked to place our appetizer and entree orders so we wouldn't have to wait too long once we were seated, and the hostess took down all our orders while also comping us for the two appetizers we ordered, and even threw in an extra comped flatbread. $37 of appetizers comped, nice! Finally at 1:20 we were led to our table at the back of the 2nd floor, which also allowed us to see how cool the restaurant really is. It reminded me a little of Novela what with the walls covered in bookcases, but Per Diem took it a couple steps further with the decoration. It felt amazingly rustic and raw, and the mini outdoor patio on the 2nd floor added a ton of ambient light to the otherwise dark space. 

The food was all really good. We ordered:
- Hummus appetizer: flatbread cracker chips and hummus, along with lots of veggies on the plate. Pretty good, worth the $9 I think
- Fried Rainbow carrot appetizer: deep fried carrots served with a yummy sauce: Good, but not a large enough portion to warrant the $12 I don't think
- Margarita Flatbread - 6 pieces, about 9 inches by 6 inches. Delicious, and the cheese was particularly noteworthy as being something other than standard mozzarella. Worth the $16
- Wild Mushroom Pasta - relatively small pasta dish served on a big plate, with a foamy sauce. Neat presentation and apparently really good, I'm really excited to pay the $19 to get this next time I come. 
- Broccoli De Cicco Flatbread - Looked good, with roasted broccoli on the top. Also $16
- Bacon Flatbread - It was decent, but I think I would have preferred a second Margarita flatbread if I could do the order over. Also $16
- Tri-Tip Sandwich - Served with fries, this sandwich came between huge toasted pieces of bread. It looked amazing!  $18
- Flank Steak - Well seasoned and garnished, but relatively small (6-8oz maybe?) and with a side of potatoes, if I recall. $28

All in all the 30 minute wait in the entrance left us in a poor mood, but the comped appetizers and the good food / cool environment / attentive waitress and hostess made up for it. I would have given 4 stars if not for these issues, but until proven otherwise I'll assume the reservation situation is not up to par. 

Per Diem, please answer your phone (or at least call back), adjust OpenTable to allow for 15 minute chunks for reservations, and finally adjust the reservation quantity so you can better seat people on time!
author: John B.
Jason A.

description: Worst dinner.  Empty place at 6:30p on Saturday night should have given us a clue. Server arrived 12 mins after sitting, forgot our appetizers, out of seabass, forgot drinks, charged wrong on the bill... no wonder they are slow. Owners must not care to lose money or realize that 40 mins meal for 6 ppl is unacceptable when there is only 4 other people in the restaurant.
author: A M.

description:
Very nice place to grab lunch in FiDi if it's for business or a special occasion.  Very nice vibes on the inside, but you're paying for it.  For appetizers we ordered the avocado toast, charcuterie board, and smoked bacon flat bread.  Have to say that the flat bread was the winner out of those!  I had the wild mushroom pasta dish.  The portion is on the small side (I chowed down that whole thing), but it tastes delicious.  The egg on top is like the cherry on top.     

The apple tart was bomb!  Even though I wasn't hungry at that point, there's always room for dessert.  The caramel ice cream on the side is a little too sweet for me, but yumm loved the tart.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Had a 7 pm reservation.  Arrived at 7:08.  Here was what followed:

7:08: Arrive to find an empty host stand.
7:17: Hostess shows up to check us in and disappears to go set up the table.
7:19: Seated.
7:22: Someone pours us some water.
7:30: Waitress appears and takes our drink orders.
7:35: Drinks appear.
7:55: I flag down our waitress as she passes by and ask if she can finally take our food order.

So we finally got our food around 8:15.  Food and drinks were mediocre.  Had a better meal at the UCSF hospital cafeteria.  Had better service pretty much anywhere.
author: Tim M.

description: Nothing super crazy about this place. Walked i during lunch with a friend and had lunch but the hostess didn't ask at first where we wanted to sit but immediately took us to the bar. Had to ask to be moved to an actual table. Service kind of slow even though it seemed they were well staffed and weren't all that busy. Food was mediocre but overpriced for sure. Got the Burrata, Tuna Salad, and the Wild mushroom pasta. Burrata was solid, Tuna Salad didn't really taste fresh and the pasta was actually pretty good.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
It was a little hard to find this place due to the small size and only subtle signage, but we're happy we did.

I ordered the flatbread with butternut squash, kale, goat cheese, and pomegranate seeds. It seems like an odd combination, but I think almost anything combines well when mixed with goat cheese. Also as expected, the presentation of our dishes was spectacular.

My husband had the mushroom pasta which came topped with an egg. It didn't look as large as most entrees we get at restaurants, but it still filled him up. I was impressed that he was satisfied by a dish that didn't contain meat or imitation meat, as that is not usually the case for him. 

We also enjoyed some of the signature cocktails. I can't recall which ones they were, but they were equally as good and fun to look at! The whole atmosphere of the place was just so relaxing and upscale. I really enjoyed our experience here.
author: Melanie P.

description:
I enjoyed my lunch here very much. 
A friend chose the place for our lunch date and while I was waiting for his arrival I read over the menu. An upscale destination with an lovely Italian fare. 
I ordered the steak with the side of bacon green beans - because keto, while he enjoyed the tri-tip st4ak sandwich with the french fries. 
The steak was grilled perfectly to medium rare, green beans were al dente, and flavors were on point. 
The place itself has a libabry feel to it, with Jack London among other famous writes books on the shelves
I would come back here again if I am in the area.
author: Anelya S.

description:
When you go on a business trip, a lot of companies allocate a certain amount of money to spend per each meal (assuming they want their employees to survive). This is called a Per Diem.  In other words, COME HERE FOR BUSINESS. 

Lots of guys in tucked-in blue shirts here. 

I could have ordered the Chicken Kale salad.  It looked good. The dressing would have come on the side.  I would have walked out, head held high, proud of myself.

I ordered the tri-tip sandwich.  Everyone else was getting sandwiches!  I'm weak. It was delicious.
author: Denis S.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner. Made reservations over the phone smoothly. Once arrived, we told them about it and was brought up immediately. 

Upstairs has a mini bar (that you can't order from) and it's pretty dimly lit. It looks like there's also a small patio but I'm not sure if people are allowed there. Also pretty warm up here. Service here was great. They're nice and helpful. 

We ordered meatballs and mussels for appetizer. There were only 4 meatballs and 2 slices of bread in 1 order... It came in a small bowl and they were kind of small. I liked the flavoring of the meatballs and sauce. Just a little disappointed in the portion size. Mussels I heard were pretty good. The sauce that it's soaked in is good; definitely goes well with the complimentary bread and butter. 

For my entree I got the squid ink linguini. The scallops and shrimp were perfectly cooked. Just enough flavoring. However I wasn't a big fan of the squid ink linguini. It was lacking any flavoring. My friends sprinkled a lot of cheese on top to give it some flavor. Not sure if it's supposed to be flavorless... But at least it was cooked well.
author: Benita M.

description: The mussels are truly amazing . The broth is almost a soup. You use the bread to soak it up. Ummmm so so good
author: Jack S.

description:
I was walking to this place to dinner and I literally walked by it since the store front is so unassuming. From the moment you walk in you're transported to a new place with high ceilings and tons of wood. 

| Food | 

Sadly for us the mussels were sold out for the night. 

- Burrata - SO GOOD! I love honey on my burrata so this was a no brainer. 5/5

- Fried Artichoke - Not my fave. It's a great fried option and went well with the aioli but since artichokes have a distinct flavor I got tired of it. 3/5

- Flank Steak - For $28 I expected more of the dish. It was good but not $28 good in my opinion. The meat was cooked well but the potion was so tiny much like the small potatoes and mushrooms they had on the side as well. I also wasn't a fan of the small onions they had and I honestly confused them with some of the mushrooms on my dish as well.  I will say that the gremolata they topped the meat with was the best part of the meal. 3/5

- Creme Brulee - I always get brulee whenever it's on the menu but I was shocked when this one came to the table. I'm used to seeing it in a round so it was weird to see it in a pastry. The custard didn't have the nice crisp on the top that you crack to get into the warm mixture. It seemed like this dessert was premade and put in a fridge to be brought out to order vs being made to order and being melt in your mouth. 2/5

| OVERALL | 

Our waitress was awesome and definitely made the experience. It's not the cheapest option for food in SF but it's a nice place to try. I saw it packed during HH so the drinks seem to be popular.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. I was on my way somewhere else and I walked by. You can't really see inside but I saw some good looking people walking in so I took a peek inside.  This place was rocking on a Thursday at 4:45 PM. The restaurant and bar was full of 30 something professionals having drinks, work meetings and a good time.  I had time to kill and I felt very comfortable sitting at the bar by myself. 

Just a really really cool vibe.  The happy hour wine was great - a Pinot. Mussels were very good, avocado toast and lobster fries (yup) looked phenomenal. Friendly bartenders. Seemed like quite a few locals - love this place.
author: Laura G.

description:
Per Diem is right around the corner from our office and we decide to come for a spontaneous holiday lunch which was nice. 

Walking in, I really liked the interior. It was cool, simple and clean and not at all pretentious. We sat on the second floor which was nice and a little more private.

We started with the Avocado Toast, which was alright as it tasted like guacamole on top of toast, the Rustic Meatballs which were surprisingly good as I'm not usually a huge fan of tomato sauce, and the Burrata Tartine which was so good, I could probably just eat it as my meal.

As for my entree, I couldn't decide what I wanted and ended up splitting 2 dishes with a co-workers so we get the best of both worlds. We got the Wild Mushroom Pasta which was good and creamy. The fried egg on top was perfectly round. We also got the Braised Short Ribs which had great flavor and was super tender. The vegetables on that plate was cooked perfectly and tasted really good as well.

Overall, it was a really good and a nice treat for lunch.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Been here a few times as it is close to my office. I prefer to sit at the bar. The bar tender is always great and so are the rest of the staff.  Food is very good.
author: A N.

description:
I have come here a couple times for work lunches and I really, really wish they had better salads. Their beet goat cheese salad is basically all large pieces
of beets and a tiny amount of greens, not really what you would hope. I have also had their chicken kale salad and it was also very meh. Great space and it has a lot of potential.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
I used to come here for happy hours when I worked corporate so I thought I'd revisit and they definitely up'd their food game.  Had their lobster fries (decent portion of meat), meatballs (super moist but sauce needs work) and their cheese board (pretty standard).  Service was attentive and the thing I admired most was that the staff seemed to genuinely enjoyed being there (sounds crazy but this attitude lacks at most places). 

Food 4
Service 4
Overall 4
author: Patrick C.

description:
recommend making reservations for lunch, we got lucky going early on a weekday but we were CLOSE to being turned away.

Everything we ordered sounds pretty simple, but all tasted fresh and amazing.

Orders: wild mushroom pasta, smoked bacon flatbread, & burrata tartine - we acted like this was dessert justifying our add on. $$$ for 2 and for lunch, worth it and would go back again.
author: Kim N.

description:
I have come here twice, both times for a weekday lunch. Both times, I made reservations, and I highly recommend you make reservations prior to coming. 

I have tried:
1. Burrata Tartine
2. Meatballs (comes with 4)
3. Burger
4. Tri-tip sandwich

The items that I liked most were the meatballs and the burrata. 

Overall, the price is a bit steep for the portion, especially the appetizers, but it is to be expected because it is located in FiDi. Does the food taste good? Yes, but it isn't anything special. I would recommend this place for anybody who wants to bring clients to lunch because you can always expect food that tastes good. It might not be great, but it will do.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
We ordered: Mushroom pasta, Mussels and Fries, and Tuna Nicoise (in order of fav to least fav). 

I give the food 3+ stars. As good as the food is, I actually ended up enjoying the bread the most. I'm not sure if it's because the food felt like standard regular food you can get at a regular tavern or American food restaurant, or because the food was a tad on the expensive side for what you get. Maybe I ordered wrong. 

Why the extra star? Great location, they take reservations, and the service was fantastic. That's what you need when you have exactly 1 hour for lunch in the Financial District!
author: Sheewon B.

description:
Dinner review.

Burrata tartine (honey, almonds, salt) - 3/5
Green bean almondine (toasted almonds, lemon brown butter) - 2/5
Wild mushroom pasta (egg, truffle sauce) - 2/5
Squid ink linguini (prawns, scallops) - 4/5

Overall, "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
Per Diem is a great spot for lunch or dinner. I've been fortunate enough to dine here a handful of times as I work nearby. 

For lunch, even though you're sitting down, you can be in and out in under 90 minutes. My favorite dish is the Burrata Tartine. It's reasonably priced for San Francisco FiDi. There's happy hour at the bar and it's not overly packed compared to similar establishments in the area. I haven't had any issues with the service. 

They have two floors where there's a spot in the second floor where you can reserve a portion of the restaurant for corporate events. Good spot. There's even a small outdoor area on the 2nd floor.
author: Bernard H.

description:
I've had my eye on this spot for a while, and finally had the chance to check it out with an old friend who happened to be in town. Walked in at 5 and weren't able to get a spot upstairs in the restaurant, so we opted for the happy hour downstairs.

We shared the burrata tartine, tempura artichoke hearts, and meatballs. The portion size was pretty decent, and the flavors were good, but not outstanding in any sort of way. Perhaps I prefer a creamier and saltier sort of buratta, and the toast was a bit too crispy for my liking (I'm more about the chew). The tempura artichoke hearts were fried well, but it felt lacking in actual artichoke heart and more about the fried bits-- we didn't finish this. The meatballs were pretty standard-- not good, not bad.

The interior itself was beautiful-- again, reminiscent of New York with dark wood paneling and a fancy but not glitzy sort of atmosphere. Happy hour downstairs was a bit loud (had to lean in a couple times to hear the person across from you) but I'd imagine it would be quieter upstairs. I'll plan to be back!

--

Edit: Been back twice but still didn't make it upstairs! They don't have any non-alcoholic drinks on the menu, and the ones that they mixed up for me were a bit lacking. I got the squid ink spaghetti tonight and while it came out pretty hot (always a plus), it lacked the umami flavor I crave in squid ink pastas, and was almost a bit sour from the tomato. The shrimps and scallops were perfectly cooked, with the shrimp being extra buttery. Portions are on the smaller side considering that I was able to finish my dish with room to spare. 3.5/5. I preferred the squid ink spaghetti at Skool.
author: Nicole H.

description: So awesome. Super cute decor, and awesome bar that me and my girlfriends all ate our full dinner at. The waiting staff were great! We came it right before closing and so they gave us a lot of attention as essentially the last people in the restaurant and chatted with us about our plans for the rest of the night. The chef even came out himself to bring me my complimentary birthday desserts! So kind!! Will definitely be going back to dine upstairs in their adorable dining area
author: Tannah B.

description:
well, sort of woof...

see, we don't have happy hour per-se in North Carolina. a special has to be a special all day, so when I get the chance to have a "HH" I'm all for it.

Well, everyone here has that same idea because this place is hot for HH. They have great specials and the cocktails are well curated, and they definitely have a regular crowd...and the bartender doesn't let you forget it. because he had a terrible attitude during our two drinks here. he took care of his regulars, didn't really seem to care about anyone else, and had a general bad attitude. shame, too, because this spot is very cute. 

the bar area is small, which probably lends to his general annoyance with being busy.

if you don't want to be busy during happy hour, well, don't offer happy hour.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Was staying at the Hilton in the Financial District on a business trip to San Francisco.  Noticed that Per Diem was not too far away and had good Yelp reviews.  The place was a bit hard to find, as the sign is not large, but the location on Yelp led us there.  We walked in to a small restaurant that also has an upstairs.  We had reservations so were quickly seated.  Unfortunately, they put us behind a large party that was having speeches through the night.  They did close a curtain to help give a bit of privacy, but it was still annoying.

The food was all good.  I ordered the Squid Ink Linguini that was great.  Good flavor, good size prawns and scallops.  For appetizers we had the burrata (fantastic), charcuterie platter (OK) and asparagus (small but good).  We also each all had our own dessert of a apple tart with salted caramel ice cream.  As you can tell, the portions were not extremely large, but the food was good, and servings were average size.

If I am back in town and staying in the area, I would consider coming back for dinner here.  There are lot of great choices in SF, but for me, this is a solid 4 star.

The only downside was that because we were sitting behind the big group, our waiter forgot about us.  However, he did make up for it with an apology, and a glass of free wine for each us.
author: Patrick M.

description:
I got there bout 15 minutes before happy hour started.  I sat myself in front of window. Great view. Nice ambience.  Asked for a menu I was given a wine bottle menu. Then finally someone else came and gave me a menu. I never received a happy hour menu which was why I was there. I however ordered a cheese board . By the time my glass of wine was finished, the server kindly told me I would have to wait there was no one to make it and i have to wait for happy hour to receive it. I was given regular menu idk why I had to wait.  20 minutes later I finally received it  server was very attentive always checkin on me. However I waited for food but I was not given happy hour pricing. Not happy. Food was ok. Good selection of cheese very small portions only served one , if curious.  Great wine selection. Not sure if I'll go
Back.  I had to wait to long to receive my good and was not compensated for having to wait so long. Disappointed.
author: Kelly H.

description:
I love this place!! Per Diem is one of the posher lunch places I've been to in the FiDi and has a fancy bar vibe even during daytime hours. The food was great, but it's definitely a reservation necessary place (and they require credit card holds). 

Since I'm a sucker for wild mushroom anything & burrata anything, I decided to order the Wild Mushroom Pasta & the Burrata Tartine. Both were really great! I really enjoyed that the pasta came with a sunnyside up egg (runny yolk is the perfect complement to all things), and the burrata had a light honey drizzle and was super creamy. 

Definitely not the cheapest lunch option. But great when you're feeling a little spendy & a little fancy.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Nearly 600 reviews and a 4 star rating -- you get the idea. This place is trustable.

The pros: The food is very good. The service is friendly.

The cons: The downstairs bar area is really small and gets full quickly. The bar service, though friendly, was a bit slow. The wait for a table was 30 minutes on a Tuesday at 6:30p. The food was solidly good, but not 30 minute wait worthy for the kind of food it is.

The drinks were tasty, but this isn't a specialty cocktail place.

It's a good place overall, but the layout really isn't great (for a date, let alone groups) once it's full -- you're really just forced to stand around with your drink in hand while you wait for a table.

(There's upstairs seating as well.)

No major complaints, but the overall experience at Per Diem felt a touch lackluster.
author: Pamela K.

description: Tbh this place was pretty "meh" food wise. I'm actually super surprised they gave a Michelin rating because their flatbread was too doughy with no flavor as was their tomato soup. The decor is beautiful and the service great so I feel like this restaurant is just one of those trendy IG places, all style and no substance.
author: Sarena P.

description: As a vegetarian with weird food allergies, my options are usually limited at restaurants. I got the millet and spring pea salad with fried capers, and I have to admit that I enjoyed the dish quite a bit. I don't know if it was the cheese or the capers, but it definitely had a savory taste that I rarely get from salads! The price seemed decent at $13, but after tax/tip I essentially paid $17 for a salad which I personally don't think it's worth. The general ambience was nice though, and it did seem like a somewhat nicer, rustic-style decor sit down restaurant.
author: Annie T.

description:
I like the antique decor and semi-Edwardian furnishings that Per Diem exudes.

Drinks are available.  Their squid ink seafood pasta was my creamy and snazzy favorite! 

Service was great and they have a host up front.  They also have an upstairs to dine about.

Ayce spot in the FiDi!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Ordered meatballs and the burrata tartine for starters and the squid ink linguine as the main dish. Paired this with 2 drinks.

Meatballs were tender. Tasted of basil and other herbs. The plate came with 4 tiny meatballs in red sauce and ricotta cheese. 

Buratta tartine was different, nothing I had ever tried. It's covered with honey, so it was more like dessert. The toasted almonds on top were delicious. 

The linguine was just okay. I was expecting a tastier plate for the price. The scallops were good. There were pieces of bell pepper that were drenched in vinegar. That definitely ruined the dish for me.

The bread was not fresh. They had it warmed up so it tasted okay, but once it cooled, it was hard and had that old bread smell. 

Drinks were overpriced. They're not generous with the amount of alcohol, I'm very lightweight and usually get a buzz on after one drink. Didn't feel much with this one.

I liked the atmosphere. Dim lighting and good service. 

Overall, I was expecting tastier dishes for the high price. Small portions and nothing extraordinary, not worth $80 for 2 people. I would not recommend.
author: Raisa G.

description: Per Diem is a solid place for work dinners and birthday dinners and group catch up dinners! The bill can run up fast so be mindful of that. House wines are pretty good. The service is friendly and I recommend the soups :).
author: Meryam B.

description:
Had a wonderful time last night on an impromptu dinner date with husband at Per Diem. Monday night and this place is BU-SAY! So I suggest you make reservations in advance if you're actually looking to snag a table. We had to sit at the bar and listen to the most annoying drunk guy berate and curse out what I assume were two co-workers for 70% of our meal (could not *wait* for him to leave).

Our bartender/server was awesome and made us the most delicious drinks called "Day Trader." Can't go wrong with that. Complimentary bread was my husband's favorite (sourdough) even if too hard for my taste. We had the meatballs to start which were tasty but I kind of stayed wanting to try the avocado toast so I guess next time that'll be it. Husband chose the flank steak with potatoes (amazing!) and I had the mushroom pasta (a little underwhelming). I thought the pasta could've used something... just couldn't put my finger on what it was. Perhaps it was not warm enough when it reached me or needed a little salt; it was just okay. Doesn't matter, though! Got to try some of my husband's scrumptious steak and chimichurri. Still giving it five stars because the place is lovely, the service great, and the drinks strong. I'll def get the steak next time we come through with reservations. Thanks for having us!
author: Joanna R.

description:
I enjoyed my lunch experience at Per Diem. My group was 8 people total, and we were able to get seated almost right away at lunchtime on a Friday. The prices are a bit more upscale, with main courses averaging around $23 dollars each. 
I enjoyed the appetizers, especially the avocado toast and burrata on toast. I ordered the mussels and fries, which were good, but I think I realized after this experience that I enjoy baked mussels a lot more. The fries were very yummy and the portion was huge. I also ordered the chocolate mousse cake dessert, and it was really well-paired with the raspberry jam and whipped cream. 
Overall, I enjoyed the vibe of this restaurant, though it is a little on the pricier side considering my personal preference for "American" food.
author: Dorene Z.

description:
Came here for dinner with our fabulous team and felt a tad bit under dressed for this place. We had reservations in advance for 10 people and we were quickly seated at the upstairs seating area. The decor of this place was nothing short of amazing, my eyes kept wandering to look at all the antiques and the detail. 
There are many times that waiters try to be impressive by memorizing orders and not writing them down then screwing up at the end. BUT, that did not happen here! Although our waiter lacked enthusiasm, he memorized drink orders, appetizers, entree orders, and desserts! That was 5 start worthy in itself! 

The most memorable appetizer to me was the Burrata Toast (toasted bread, burrata cheese, toasted almonds, and honey drizzle). Instantly love at first bite! The Charcuterie board had plenty of variety but wasn't the most stand-out dish. All main dishes were proportioned to the plate and the pasta sauces were intriguingly foamy and light. The squid ink linguini was light and I only wish I had more! The scallops were perfect and tasty. 
For dessert, the apple tart with caramel ice cream was the best! It was flaky and not overbearingly sweet. The triple chocolate cake was very rich, but add some raspberry sauce and a scoop of their caramel gelato, for some reason, it masked the richness. 

Don't forget to check-in to get 100% off a to-go coffee! Word from a coworker is that they had the best strong coffee she's ever had ;) While this place is a little out of my price range for a regular night, I absolutely loved my dining experience.
author: Jenna T.

description:
In the universe of sit down SF lunch spots, I'd equate Per Diem to Perry's:  menu of items that sound better than what actually arrives, full portions, reasonable prices, good list of beers/wines. 

I had a beet salad that was a pile of (what seemed maybe like canned) beets with some horseradish cream. I love beets, but there was little going on here except a pile of bite sized beet chunks.

My friend had a burger and house salad. Seems like they might have put more effort into describing the burger's unique awesomeness on the menu than in bringing anything special to the plate. 

The decor is very interesting. Easy to get a reservation. Not bad food, but a place where appearances are better than culinary reality. 

A yeoman work-lunch spot.
author: Lanny B.

description:
Well, now I'm not quite sure why I bookmarked Per Diem.  Did someone write a great review or something?  The menu was pretty uninspired.  It was certainly a good location for meeting my cousin, though, who was getting her hair cut at the Galleria, and you could practically roll there from the BART Montgomery stn.  I had expected something that looked more like John's or Tadich's.  The decor here felt more like someplace in Frontierland.  We were seated upstairs, which was quieter.  I appreciated that, because I knew it would be a gab fest.

We did not order drinks.  I was between the Tuna Nicoise salad and the mussels.  M. got the tri tip sandwich, and was willing share the fries so I went ahead with the mussels.  As Cherylynn  mentioned in her 2012 review, the mussels were very tiny, but tasty.  There was very little broth with mine, and it was just white wine with a little garlic.  I thought the portion was small, and I wished they had been served in a deeper bowl, so they would have stayed hotter and allowed more broth. They only gave me one toast point with it though, so I wouldn't have been able to soak up much more.  The tri tip looked a little well done for my taste, and I forgot to ask how she liked it, but it looked good, especially the caramelized onions.  The fries unfortunately weren't very hot, and could have used a little longer in the fryer, but we managed to down all of them.

Service was excellent.  There when we needed him, not when we didn't, had a good sense of humor and patient with us as we chatted away long after finishing our food.
author: Diane B.

description: The salad and the flat bread were good. The New York strip steak was only a few, pre-sliced pieces of steak and not a whole steak as one night expect. The fish was also mediocre. For the price, the entrees should have been better.
author: Paul L.

description: Thoughtful menu and good service. Steam Punk and Trendy. A good addition to the Finical District food scene.
author: Anthony P.

description: Came here once for a solo dinner. The service was great (bartender was very helpful as far as wine selection), but I thought the portions were too small for the price. I got the pasta dish, and I didn't feel full when I left.
author: Kelsi K.

description: Lovely location with outstanding service and tasty food. I have been here for both lunch and dinner and thoroughly enjoyed it both times. Reservations recommended.
author: Angela L.

description:
The decor and the food here is incredible. We were able to easily secure reservations for my team for lunch and were promptly taken to the top level when we arrived. 

I had the mushroom pasta (which is was highly recommended by my waitress) and it was super yummy. She asked if I'd like to add chicken to it, I said yes, and it was amazing. Highly recommend going this route if you want some extra protein and want to make it filling enough for leftovers!

Also highly recommended was the Burrata Tartine. Holy crud - this might be my new favorite thing! I could tell the burrata was super fresh and the honey and slivered almonds they put on top was the perfect compliment. 

My teammates got the fried chicken sandwich, the mussels, the bacon flatbread (I snuck a bite, INCREDIBLE), and the millet and chickpea salad. All got rave reviews from them. 

I'll definitely come back here!
author: Kat L.

description:
Closer to 3.5 stars but the interior ambiance created by the decor rounds this up for me. You will notice the dark old world pieces as you are waiting to be seated. You can't exactly miss the ornate and intricate chandelier above your head as you wait for your table. This feels like a great spot for a cozy intimate dinner, or for large groups as well. 

Our group decided to share a bunch of dishes family style. The standouts for me were probably the Squid Ink Linguine and the Steamed Mussels. The Filet and Lobster Fries were meh. 
Our cocktails were all solid but nothing memorable. 

Service was polished and warm and overall a fine establishment that I'll probably never come back to as there is really just too much competition in SF.
author: Dennis W.

description: Great atmosphere. Boozy yet yummy cocktails. Good food. This is definitely a good place to go on a date
author: Zeni B.

description: Vegetarian Review:  I had the avocado toast and sautéed cauliflower.  Both were very yummy.  I especially enjoyed the capers and the little red peppers which were full of flavor and just the right amount of spicy.  Service was great from start to finish.
author: LaSha G.

description:
Have been going here for years, and I like it for happy hour, nibbles lunch and dinner. 

Prices are not overly expensive and drinks are made very well. Menu changes seasonal but there is always something that people like. 

Mass whisky collection and you cannot go wrong coming here. There are some night that are busier than others. Make reservations for larger parties for dinner.
author: Mei L.

description:
Had to make an edit in the time since someone commented and said I got the times wrong. When I checked my open table it is actually 11:15am and that is when they open. I put 11AM by accident open. I didn't get the  wrong restaurant. Just wrote the wrong time. Not a great customer experience when the manager comments and said I got the wrong restaurant and doesn't care about how I was treated. 

I really like the food here. I've only been here for dinner once and lunch a few times, but the last time I didn't appreciate the hostess or managers attitude. I have a reservation at 11:15am and they don't open till 11:15am and at 11:15am the doors were still locked, so I knocked and no response. At 11:20am I started to knock again, but longer this time. Someone finally opens the door and goes OK I HEARD YOU THE FIRST TIME JEEZ!! Straight up rolled her eyes. I go you open at 11:15am and it's 11:20...she goes well we weren't ready. First if you take reservations at 11:15 and you open at 11:15 you should be ready..maybe don't take reservations till 11:30. Also you are in the heart of the Fidi where plenty of business lunches happen...if I was with a client and this happened it would be so embarrassing. She could have opened the door and said give me a few more minutes. Just ruins my experience here.
author: Karen H.

description:
I've eaten at Per Diem a few times now, which is slightly unusual for me as I try to eat at different spots now that I only travel to San Francisco and don't live there. But, I have enjoyed all my evenings there so I imagine I'll likely find myself here again at some point in the future.

Now anyone who knows me knows that I love a cheese plate. Heck, you don't even have to know me, just read a few of my reviews and you will soon realize that I have a deep love for cheese. So, naturally, I have ordered the cheese and charcuterie board from Per Diem and it has always been delightful. I have also enjoyed the Burrata Tartine, Wild Mushroom Pasta, Braised Beef Short Ribs, a Marinated Garden Beet salad, pickled vegetables, and french fries. 

The service has always been friendly and efficient and while it's often busy the wait has yet to be unbearably long. The cocktails are good, as is the wine list. And all of these things add up to an experience that has always been positive, which is probably why I find myself here again and again.
author: Tiffany N.

description: We had dinner at Per Diem last evening and it was  amazing and wonderful. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Our table was lovely, quiet so we could actually hear each other without yelling. We ordered wine and it was brought right away. Our server, Kim was beyond delightful. We enjoyed chatting with her throughout the meal. We ended up sharing with her that we were celebrating the passing of my friends mom who's birthday it was yesterday. She would have been 95.  After our delicious dinner, Kim surprised us by bringing out a chocolate pudding dessert so we could celebrate and acknowledge my friends moms birthday! We were beyond moved and touched. For dinner we had the meatballs (amazing), roasted tomatoe soup and roasted cauliflower with golden raisins, capers and Serrano Chile's. All was spectacular and perfectly sized plates. One cool detail is that Per Diem serves their food on a hot plate or bowl as needed. I love that detail. Thank you Kim, and Per Diem staff for a really wonderful night!!
author: Linda Y.

description:
Came with a party of 6 and reservations were really easy to make! Location really great for anyone working/living in Financial District and can see why a lot of people would come here after work! There is an upstairs section as well with tables so you don't feel crammed.

We started off with the charcuterie & cheeseboard - presentation of this was really nice and the meats and cheeses were pretty good too. Nothing out of the ordinary, the only thing that would have bene nice is if the waiter pointed out the names for each.

Main entrees we got the wild mushroom pasta, truffle mushroom flatbread, and the squid ink linguini. Out of the two pastas, I enjoyed the wild mushroom pasta more. There was a lot of hype around the squid ink pasta, but personally did not think it was anything extraordinary. Tasted like any other squid ink pasta you would get but a little lighter on the sauce (+1 if that's your thing!). As for the truffle mushroom flatbread, this was meh as well. I would definitely skip on this.

And last but not least we got an order of the lobster fries, another thing that was hyped up. Unfortunately this was a bit of a letdown as well. Mainly a lot of cheese with not much lobster. Could probably buy the ingredients and make it myself at home.

Worst part of this meal was that when we were ordering our waiter told us that we were ordering too much for our group and that we should probably take something off the list. I understand that he was just trying to help but let me be hungry and just take my money!! 

3.5 stars - would probably not come back again, but very convenient location for dinner after work if you are looking for a good atmosphere with decent food - just don't expect to be blown away.
author: Megan K.

description:
I came here for dinner with my coworkers and it was delicious! Everything was great, and I definitely ate everything in front of me because shit, I wasn't paying for it or anything.

Standouts for me:
- avocado toast
- wild mushroom pasta
- burrata tartine

I plan to come back and try the bone marrow. I wanted to order it, but my boss is a total health guy, marathoner and all, and I figured it wasn't worth the potential look of judgment. 

TIP: avoid during happy hour unless you want to drown in a sea of tech bros.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Per Diem is a solid, reasonably priced, FiDi lunch spot. I work at 2nd/Folsom and most FiDi sit down options (or the ones at Embarcadero Center) are just too far away. If you want to go during prime lunch time, you will need to make a reservation several days in advance. 

We were seated at a two top upstairs. The restaurant filled up within minutes. We ordered our meals and the food came out very quickly. My former boss had the Salmon Nicoise salad, which he clearly enjoyed. I had the Smoked Bacon flatbread. It was very satisfying and just the right size for lunch. 

Although Per Diem is not a budget lunch option, it is about 10-20% cheaper than other restaurants of similar quality and ambiance in the area. Inevitably, I'll be back.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Came in on a Thursday evening and it was busier than I expected but the food came out really quickly! Especially liked the avocado toast and fried artichoke hearts. Everyone behind the bar was friendly and the cocktails are a really good price for this side of town. Got a Golden Gate Spritz, super refreshing! 

Would definitely come in again for lunch during the week. Didn't have a beer while I was here but they've got a great selection on tap.
author: Sirijit P.

description:
What a fun new place to discover in the heart of the financial district!

Quick highlights:
1- Awesome happy hour including discounted beer, wine, cocktails and snacks. Pretty good wine at $10 a glass - a steal in this area!
2- Atmosphere is wonderful. Great design, upbeat music at the right volume, and bustling vibe.
3- Service! Service, service, service goes a long way. The host was wonderful at keeping an eye open for a table for us and was extremely friendly. Bartender was beyond accommodating (offered to exchange a beer that ended up being hoppier than anticipated) and the waitress was pleasant and checked in at a good pattern.

Get the happy hour wine, order the burrata flatbread, and you'll be a happy camper! 

My only slight piece of advice is to do a little more wine training with the wait staff. This Bay Area is pretty educated on wine and we were told "Napa Cab" and "Sauv Blanc" but not the producer or anything else.
author: Haeley G.

description:
Went here for a casual dinner the other night after loving it the first time my old boss took me.

I love live jazz and older themed restaurants so the gold rush vibe and candles were fun to be around. They even had real books lining the walls! 

We had the rustic meatballs, wild mushroom pasta, squid ink linguini, and apple tart which were all fantastic. I had the linguini which was perfectly salted, lemony, and well-proportioned. I feel like it's a great starter if you're not sure what to order here.

Might've picked a bad night though because a large party was seated right next to us with mics, which had a lot of loud feedback. When the hostess was leading me to the table, the crowd wouldn't part for her and she apologized to me (definitely not her fault).
author: Wendy C.

description:
Per Diem gives off a very upscale vibe. Located in the heart of FiDi, its great place to hang out with professionals for happy hour or a nice dinner date with your lover. I came after work on a Tuesday with my friend for drinks and dinner. The bottom level is where the bar and lounge area is, upstairs are tables for dinner. The pricing for food and drinks weren't too bad, especially because the portions were generous.

I started with a Teeling Peachy cocktail for $12 - Teeling Whisky, Combier Pêche, Lemon,
Sugar, Peach Bitters, Cremant Brut Rosé. This drink is totally girly, sweet, bubbly and easy to drink. 

Pimm's Spritz - Henricks gin, Pimms, Cucumber, Ginger, Lemon, Prosecco. Tasted just like a gin and tonic with the extra refreshing taste of cucumber.

Smoking Mule - Del Maguey Vida Mezcal, Pamplemousse, Pineapple Gomme, Lemon, Ginger Beer - Just like the name, this drink is smoky flavored!

Get the Duck Liver Pate $15 - so rich and creamy, it comes with a huge portion of pate, fig jam and grain mustard with rustic toast. There wasn't enough toast for the amount of pate but we killed the rest using the table bread so that worked out fine.

Squid Ink Linguini $26 - The squid ink pasta is house made, comes with 3 prawns and 2 large scallops in a lemon emulsion sauce. Such a simple dish yet packed with flavor! I loved it! 

My friend ordered the Filet Mignon & Lobster Fries $36 - there's a lobster tail shell on top of a large basket of fries, but we came to the conclusion that there wasn't a whole lobster tail in the basket of fries, just small bits of lobster meat in the creamy sauce. Filet Mignon was a good size, very filling meal.

I had a good time, there weren't a lot of people since we had dinner early on a Tuesday, the service was excellent and I'd definitely come again.
author: Janny S.

description: Great food and great service. That bourbon margarita was on point... definitely recommend
author: María F.

description:
For a snazzy burger in a bar type feel, why the hell not. I was coming in for the Oxtail Poutine fries sadly the chef that use to make this dish is no longer with the establishment, oh well let me just try their french onion burger medium and throw an egg on that bad boy.

The burger presentation was flawless, with a side of fries you can't lose. the bun was buttery and soft, the bottom of that bun though was crisp, did the meat hold up yes, did the egg break yes, did it matter HELL NO, I was sitting there licking my fingers after I ate this deliciousness. Would I recommend this place hell yes for a burger for me that defines snazzy burger in the fidi!!! A little bit more about this burger, I ordered medium, it was cooked medium, juiciness explosion on every bite, added a fried egg and that bad boy was seasoned lightly with sea salt, it's like they know me haha, that bun again buttery softness on top, crunch on bottom, holding the decadent meat made well with a fried egg.... Heaven status!!!!!

the fries were ok, standard, no frills, but that burger.... GEEZ gonna have to come back

Sampled one of their ales the newport nector ale, not to hoppy not to heavy, just clean and crisp finish paired well with a delicious burger

Did I mention get the french onion burger?? LOL

burger ***** one of the better burgers I have had in a long time in the city
service ***** helpful staff, asked about the oxtail poutine fries, sadly they told me the story of how the chef that use to make it is no longer there and it could not be reproduced
price $$ for what I paid, should of ordered 1 togo
ambiance ***** fancy, bar feel, pick a drink or to, there is an upstairs but did not venture up there, small tables maybe meant for 3 people but vibe is nice
author: Clarence A.

description:
My friend and I came here after work last night (without reservations) and they were very accommodating. While they did not have tables at the dining room upstairs, they said we could get a drink at the bar and they would get us a table downstairs as soon as one became available...10-15 minutes. 

The decor of this place is vintage up-scale and the ambiance was very nice. Prices are reasonable for FiDi area and food was solid --- flavorful, well-cooked and satisfying. We ordered the steamed mussels, liver pate, squid ink linguine (the scallop was cooked excellently) and patrale sole.  Enjoyable dinner in a great setting!
author: Joan S.

description:
Came for a work lunch with my team here today.

Seems quite popular - both for work lunches and not. We sat upstairs at a table for 8 and were served promptly.

I had the braised short rib that came with roasted veg and a smattering of mashed potato. The meat was melt in the mouth soft and cooked to perfection. The veg were ok.

Had a side of Brussel Sprouts that came with bacon, apple and parsley and they were nice though a little undercooked.

The place has a trendy ambience to it, and it's about 20 something dollars for a main. Mine was $24 and the side of Brussels was $8. A coke is $3.

A nice place to try out if you're in town
author: Jemma B.

description:
3.5 stars from me.

Per diem pops up every time I look for a lunch restaurant in FiDi so I finally decided to give it a shot with a few girlfriends from work. If you cant get a reservation you have have to wait to get a table during peak lunch hours. We had to wait about 20 minutes before we were seated, our server was nice enough to bring out waters before we asked for them.
Ordered the seasonal soup - butternut squash (was a tad bit low on salt but still very fresh ), margarita flatbread and the Mediterranean flatbread. Big plus - they serve margarita with burrata cheese! Though the food was quite normal, nothing too special.
author: Reema B.

description:
I made reservations for lunch. Love the fact that I can make reservations. Seating on the first and 2nd floor. We sat upstairs. Dark wood decor. The food was okay. My friends and I got the **Squid Ink Linguini, **Salmon Nicoise Salad, **Truffle Mushroom Flat Bread and a side of Fries. Fries need more seasoning. We shared everything. It wasn't anything spectacular but not bad. I will come back.

The only thing I didn't really like was that the server did push a little too hard for us to get drinks. It's lunch time, I don't think I want to go back to my work buzzed. But overall he was okay but didn't really his approach for drinks.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Don't get me wrong for only giving them three stars, but I think that is only in proportion to the price you pay.

Dishes:
Squid Ink Linguini- For $25, I think they thought less was more to demonstrate the high quality of the food. However, I didn't really think so. The linguini was good, but the butter/oil/sauce at the bottom made me question what it was. It almost looked like condensed water that the chefs forgot to take out before placing it in the bowl. Moreover, it was served at a lukewarm temperature and the seafood was a little too salty for my liking. Try it for yourself, maybe I just came on the chef's bad day. 

Croque Madame- probably the more "bang for your buck" option. This was actually quite good! The cheese was melted on top and a little toasted. The egg was able to get the runny-level that allowed the yolk to flow over the bread. The bread itself was crunchy too and you get two thick slices of it. 

Overall, this was a generally pleasant place but I probably wouldn't go here again any time soon. It's definitely a place that looks prettier than it tastes. Try somewhere else if you have a list of restaurants to try in SF. This can be at the middle-bottom of the list.
author: Sammy T.

description:
This is the type of fancy lunch spot for those who are willing to spend a little more for full on service, but may still walk out hungry.

I came here 2 weeks in a row for different occasions. The 1st week was for a late company holiday lunch. Here is where I ordered the Nicoise salad and a side of fries. The salad was beautifully sculpted on my plate. However the plate was probably 2x the size of the salad. The salad was quite small for the price being being paid.

The 2nd week, I went with my girlfriend. We both had ordered the ham and cheese sandwich minus the ham. It was only OK for us,  Service was slow on this day, as the restaurant was packed by noon. 

I'd still come back in the future..
author: Tracy C.

description:
If I lived a more sophisticated lifestyle where I had more money to spend (and I didn't hate having to wear real pants when out in public), I would happily come here every day for their happy hour. Well made cocktails, tasty small plates, and a nice atmosphere. It seems like it typically gets pretty packed with FiDi folks right after work for the HH specials, and so I'd recommend making a reservation if you have a larger group, as there's limited seating and standing room. 

P.S. If you really want to treat yo'self, get the french fries topped with lobster and champagne butter sauce. Yes, this is apparently a thing...a really delicious, indulgent, thing. The fries on their own taste like the best version of McDonald's fries you could possibly order - salty, crispy, and hot. And then when these fries are paired with chunks of lobster and buttery champagney goodness, then oh my goodness. This dish is on the menu to be typically served with the filet, but you can order the fries separately for around $22. DO IT.
author: Stacy K.

description:
Came here with a reservation for 6 with my coworkers on a Thursday afternoon. We were running late and asked to push the reservation  back twice, but they were very accommodating even with a slightly rude reply when I called the second time. We were seated upstairs and really liked the decor of the atmosphere. There's a bar upstairs too, which was convenient so people wouldn't have to go up and down the stairs. I started off with their lemonade, which was delicious and unlimited refills! My waiter took my lemonade when I was halfway done and I tried to stop him but he said he was refilling it, phew! Haha. We started off with a few appetizers to share before our main entree. Be sure to ask for bread as it is upon request.

- charcuterie: loved the rye bread, but the fish wasn't anything special. It is a nice to have when there's a large party and we need something to munch on.
- corn soup (seasonal): loved this! There was a kick of spice to it, and the portion was super generous. I had an entire bowl to finish and it definitely made me full before my main meal. I would reorder this dish for sure!
- smoked bacon flatbread: super tasty as well. We each got one slice and the flatbread had a crisp and was perfectly thin, so it wasn't over filling. The bacon and arugula was perfect. Would reorder again, too.
- rustic meatballs: also worth ordering again because the meatballs were super tasty and tomato-y. The bread went well with the leftover cheesy sauce. Meatballs were soft enough and flavorful enough.
- mussels and fries: super generous portion again with a full bowl of fries. I couldn't finish my fries, but the flavor of the garlic and sweet onions in the mussels sauce made me finish our entrees first! Super tasty and easy to eat with the little fork. Fries were perfectly tasty too. My coworkers ordered the same dish and loved it as well. They even tossed the fries in the remaining sauce because it was that tasty!
- steak and fries: I got to try my coworker's and thought the steak was cooked a little too bland. It lacked flavor, but the fries and tomatoes were on point.

Service was fast and super accommodating once we sat down. Food was delicious and I definitely recommend trying this place out.
author: Amanda C.

description: Went for a lunch meeting and had the chicken kale salad! Super tasty!
author: Maria R.

description: Late review of going to this establishment back during April 13 2018. I liked the place a lot, waiting for a friend for an hour, while drinking coffee and doing some paperwork. Had space, not crowded, as of 3pm on a Friday afternoon. Waiters are polite and responsive. Had a happy hour burger, delicious but short lived. Overall other than the food that was short lived, I liked the atmosphere, I liked places that aren't to crowded, so as to not having to getting into a yelling competition. My friend commented on the same thing. Would come back here again.
author: Logan S.

description:
Went for a basic dinner. Very amazed with the food and ambience. 

I got the roasted chicken and my wife got the cauliflower. Dessert was the chocolate and ice cream. No wine. So the chicken was easily the best chicken i have ever eaten. Hot and juicy. Crispy on edges. The apples were a great touch. The dessert was also hot and cold blended so well. The price is worth the food. 

The ambience was so relaxing. Nice chair and couch. All the staff was kind and chill. Very helpful. Even the bathroom was up scale.
author: Brian G.

description:
Per Diem is always crowded for dinner, even on any oddball day of the week. This is a true testament to how awesome their food is. I've even been turned away on a random Tuesday (not that I'm complaining) because they were at full capacity for the evening. Not a lot in the area (Fidi+downtown) with a similar ambiance or tastefulness that you'd find in other neighborhoods with more nightlife. Not much else open for dinner within a 2 block radius after 7pm here.

Filet Mignon and Lobster Fries 4/5: Yum! A great mix of 2 great surf and turf options with a twist. Super tender meat, could have used more flavor in the lobster, but the texture was good.

Truffle Mushroom flatbread 3.5/5: Would have preferred more truffle oil, but really great flaky flatbread crispiness. About enough to go around for a 4-person appetizer sampler. Not the best standalone appetizer for the table.

French onion soup 4/5: oily sauteed onion goodness.

The only beef I have here is that the service is a bit lacking, likely due to the high volume of customers.
author: Kathy T.

description: Loud, chaotic and over-priced for sub-par food. Rude bartender, but terrific waitress.
author: Judy P.

description: This place is poppin' on weekdays at lunch. Definitely make a reservation if you can. The drink menu was really impressive and the food was good, although the menu is on the small side. The restaurant is also decorated very nicely but is on the dark side. It has a romantic feel to it.
author: Kaila W.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience here. I made reservations for lunch with my colleagues on a Thursday afternoon, as it can get crowded quickly. The food and service are both exceptional, but nothing too amazing. For starters, we ordered the burrata tartine, and it definitely deserves all the hype!! The meatballs were good, but nothing special. My wild mushroom pasta was one of the best pasta dishes I've had in awhile. It was creamy/foamy, yet light at the same time--truly an interesting dish. The portions are good for lunch, but pricey for what you get. However, considering the restaurant's location in the FiDi, I'd say the prices are not too shabby.
author: Christal C.

description: Overall I thought the food was ok. Steak was overcooked for medium rare. Most of the food was kinda salty. The price was more than 2 $$. Staff was nice tho. I'd rate this place 3.5  but since there isn't a half, I give them 4 .
author: Duy N.

description: Cocktail and service were great but the food.. we had pasta and it was the worst pasta I ever tried. It felt like it was made of soya or something else, very unnatural and tasteless. I can recommend this place for drinks and haven't tried any other food besides pasta, so can't comment on other dishes. Just stay away of that pasta if you decide to it here
author: Evgeny C.

description: Such a great spot to meet for lunch. I ordered a pasta and it was light and flavorful without giving me a food coma before heading back to the office. It's fancier than I thought it would be but maybe that's just the SF way. Kinda pricey though. 1 arnold palmer, 1 salad, a piece of toast, and pasta came out to $60.
author: Bianca V.

description:
One day of the top 3 burgers I've ever had in my lifetime.  The side salad with it was also phenomenal.  Great service as well.

I'll be coming back!
author: Matthew K.

description:
Three words: tri-tip sandwich. You need to know nothing more and nothing less. You just need to order it to experience pure deliciousness! Crunchy, meaty, cheesy, salty, sweet (carmalized onions). It was perfect.

And our server, lovely Jessica with the oh-so-tiny waistline (she must not eat those tri-tip sandwiches every time she works there as I surely would), recommended Thyme and Potion, a very tasty and herbaceous cocktail, as she described it, to accompany my lunch. Yum!

That was days ago and I'm still thinking about that entire experience and wondering when I can repeat it again! Seriously.
author: Kim N.

description: Only giving 3 stars for atmosphere. I was super disappointed  Ordered filet mignon and lobster, I asked for medium and the filet cane well done. Good flavor though. My fiancé had the meatballs, they were cold... we also had the bib lettuce salad, it was super bland with little to no dressing. The table shared a margarita flatbread, also bland and chewy. Bummed. Nice decor.
author: Shondi F.

description: This place is a hidden gem. I was on my way somewhere else and I walked by. Chicken sandwich was great.
author: Harold B.

description: I have to say I was very impressed.  The food was great and service was good.  The prices were reasonable with a great selection for lunch.  This will be one of my new go-to work lunch locations!
author: John F.

description: Per Diem is perfect for a work lunch. The decor is cute, the food is good, and the service has always been great!
author: Mackenzie L.

description: Had a business lunch here today and the food was great!  Service was on the slow side as we must have waited over 15 mins before we ordered.  Other than that, our server was friendly and the place was bustling.  I had the short ribs plate which was good at first but once i added the grilled caramelized onions from my friend's french dip sandwich, it was a whole different entree.  I would suggest asking for a side of the grilled caramelized onion to add to your short rib plate.  The presentation was on point and food was delicious.  As long as my customers are happy, I'm a happy camper! =)
author: Melanie N.

description: First of all, I love the name. That peaked my interest. Once you get heat, it's a classic old school downtown SF bar. Wood paneling, high ceilings, a homey yet industrial vibe. They have a great cocktail menu and draft beer list. The food is inventive twists on great fare. I had the squid ink linguine, which comes with scallops and shrimp - it was delicious. If you're looking for food or drink downtown, this place is worth checking out
author: Gordon F.

description: The mushroom pasta! *Rant & Rave* So freaking good. We literally asked for bread to sop up the left over sauce. We embarrassingly stopped them from clearing it twice it was so good. Drinks were good too. And service was great.
author: Jessica H.

description:
