First off, the service was extremely slow. Our drinks took at least 30 minutes, and our food took even longer. When our food finally did arrive there were two mistakes in the orders. There was also a mixup with our dessert. Also, after mentioning multiple times that we were celebrating a birthday the waitress eventually forgot to put a candle in the dessert. At a nice restaurant like this I simply do not expect such terrible service. 

A random complaint my friends had about the restaurant was the music choice. The music was extremely slow and quite frankly made us all feel like we were falling asleep. This may just be our groups opinion because we are relatively young?

The food was decent, although not amazing enough to come back for. The mushroom pizza with an egg was the best dish we ordered
author: Ashwin S.

description:
A fabulous little places that's a little tucked away on the edge of the financial district. I walked in and was surprised at the beautiful decor of the place. And what's even better is that the food is great too. The service is a little slow during lunch, but if you have a bit of time and are looking for good food in nice surroundings, this is a good choice. 

I had the Fungi Pizza, which was good. And don't forget to order some truffle fries for your table.
author: Mariko F.

description: Looking for great service staff, excellent food, attentive management, strong location for a business lunch. Look no further than Per Diem. They took care of all our ambience and food needs. Super attentive without being too imposing. And their fish + steak mains are to die for. If you dont reserve this place for your business lunches, i have only one question. Why???
author: Sana C.

description: Went for Lunch today and the server was just not a happy camper. She was not that helpful and you could tell that she did not want to be there. I ordered the lamb and it just was not that much food and not that good. I will not be coming back.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Make a reservation in advance (open table was unavailable, so we directly called the restuarant and got a table for 5). We ordered pasta, burger, salads, but the best choice of them all was the Oyster Po'Boy. It was the perfect amount of crispy, and it had a nice zing to it w/ the pickle. It came with salad, so we got fries on the side. Overall, we had a great experience. We got seating upstairs (great view). The ambiance is different, and takes you away from the city-feel. We all really enjoyed our lunch and will definitely be back.
author: Ameera D.

description:
Love the ambiance of this space! Sometimes I notice a restaurant's fancy exterior helps to distract from the inferior food...but not at Per Diem. You get the whole package!

First, I have to say, any place that serves a dish where my sister-in-law (who I believe is a small, picky little birdy inside a grown lady body) CLEANS THE WHOLE PLATE is the shizz in my book. 

Said plate? The Short Ribs...I tried 'em...I would clean my whole plate too! Hell, I always clean my plate...what am I saying!

Solid cocktails, excellent wine list and delicious and satisfying food (for even the pickiest eater).

Don't miss the bone marrow and burrata to start, and the short ribs and bucatini are excellent to follow. The chicken was exceptional!

Service was awesome and a good time was had by all...especially the picky eater!
author: Christy L.

description:
Eclectic but nice.  Very good service - promptly seated and served lunch on a Friday.  Dungness Crab Sandwich with Salad is not  a bad deal for $15 in the Financial District.

Rate a 3.5
author: Scott L.

description:
Want to catch up with a friend after a hard day at work.  Go here!  You can easily have a great dinner with good service and be able to enjoy a conversation with good drinks in hand.  We dined downstairs near the bar which was quite comfortable at the tall tables.  The burata on crostone with honey and toasted almonds was a great starter, and the cioppino was wonderful.  Not a lot of broth which I prefer, but just enough to enjoy the flavor and dip my bread in, and lots of great seafood.  The pasta looks good as well, but I was too busy enjoying my cioppino to ask my dining companion for a bite.  

This could easily be a great place for a power lunch/dinner if you're working on closing a deal.  Just wish they were open on the weekends for us folks that don't work in the Fi-Di.  I think it's worth making a trip down though and I can't wait to go back and try more menu items and check out the dining room.
author: Maria S.

description:
Was in town for work and coworkers and I decided to grab dinner at Per Diem as it was close to the office.

Pros:
+ easy to get reservations on a Tuesday night 
+ two floors. Downstairs is the bar with happy hour and upstairs is dinner seating
+ good wine list

Cons:
- ordered half dozen oysters (not during happy hour) and not only were they small, but they were warm. Not sick... Yet
- price is on par with other establishments in FiDi but their main and salad portions seem much smaller than their competitors 

Overall, OK experience but the fact that they served warm oysters kinda kills it for me. Will not return.
author: Jo W.

description:
I've been here several times and what seems to be consistent is the bad service. I think the food is good, if a little overpriced. The first time I went I refrained from writing a review because the manager was really gracious about the bad service we had received. 

However, today we sat at the bar and were waited on by a bartender who appeared to be pretty put out by our presence. Our order included a mushroom pizza without the prosciutto and rigth before being served, the bartender asked if any of us was allergic to prosciutto. We said no, but that we don't eat it. Within a minute the pizza arrived WITH the prosciutto. REALLY? She made herself scarce after delivering the pizza, so it took quite a while to get her attention and ask for a replacement. I thought it was pretty ballsy to pull that move.

I gave it 3 stars because the food is good. But the management needs to put some serious effort into improving the service.
author: Lisa F.

description:
So glad I finally got to try this place! 
Came here for lunch with a good friend on a random weekday.  
Brussel sprouts are a must.  I got the Chicken entree and my friend got the lamb.  
We sat upstairs, beautiful decor, could be a little more lit but I get it.
Cant wait to come back again for dinner
author: Wenter S.

description:
Gorgeous & sophisticated space with seating both downstairs and upstairs. Opt for the upstairs!

Came here Saturday evening with reservations made an hour before. The place wasn't busy at 6:30 and we were seated in a pretty empty area upstairs.

Drink:
Land Grab (Mezcal, agave, citrus, pineapple juice)- 2.5 stars. This tasted like an alcoholic barbeque sauce drink.

Eat:
Mushroom Pizzetta: 4 stars. More of a flatbread than a pizza, but oh so delicious! It was simple and had a good blend of flavors. Each bite ended with a sweet taste. Not cheesy at all!

Bucatini: 3 stars. Reminded me of spaghetti (pasta is tougher and requires more chewing). I didn't think the dish was as amazing as raved.

Overall, a gorgeous place but I wasn't that impressed by the food/drinks.
author: Emily C.

description:
We came here on a work lunch and were seated promptly. After looking over the menu for a bit, I decided on the cioppino and the table shared their assorted bread basket. 

There were three different types of breads -- a whole wheat loaf, a French loaf and flat breads. Olive tapenade and a butter/mascarpone cheese served as the accompaniments. I absolutely loved my cioppino! It had a lot of seafood and the tomato sauce was rich and balanced. My coworkers also polished off their entrees.

I will certainly suggest this place the next time we need a lunch spot. I'm also very interested in coming here for dinner, too.
author: Alice W.

description:
Upon walking in at 6pm on a Saturday night, my dad and I were like uh oh this place is completely empty is that a sign of things to come?  We walked in and the hostess was talking to another employee and decided to ignore me till they finished their quick chat.  When we finally checked in, we were brought upstairs to what was a beautiful dining room.  It has the feel of a exclusive club with books lined up on the wall and comfortable dining chair and tables.  

We ordered the poutine, meatball, papperdelle and the fettuccine to share.  It's hard to find poutine and this one had oxtail so I was excited about it.  I thought it lacked gravy and cheese curds and was too salty.  The same could be said about the meatball, it was too salty and for $9, there was only one meatball.  The two pastas came and it seemed as if they knew they put too much salt in their appetizers so they decided to compensate by not putting any salt on the pastas.  Both of them were extremely bland.

The food really wasn't worth what we paid and it was just disappointing.  It's pretty safe to say I won't be back.
author: Pierre L.

description: Giving three stars because I love the dark and stormies here. Would like to give less because of the fries. I ordered the "Fries & Thyme" for $6 off the menu. I kid you not, the fries they gave us were a small basket full of McDonald's fries. There's no way they weren't. There also wasn't any seasoning or herbs on the fries beyond the typical McDonald's smell and overt saltiness. Granted, maybe they fried the fries a bit more to make them crispier than McDonald's, but they definitely weren't worth $6. Common guys, who do you think you're fooling?
author: Alexander P.

description:
Came here for a business luncheon yesterday but boy was it anything but 'business'... This place is only a block away from our firm and I didn't even knew it existed, sad indeed.

Let's jump right into the atmosphere, L-U-V-E-D it, the paintings, the chandelier, the cabin/loft style, the bar, the seats...in awe!! Needless to say, the luncheon turned into a sex in the city scene quickly.

Food: woohoo! had the baby romaine with anchovy dressing, the SOTD (YUMMY buttery squash soup), Burrata on a grilled crostone which I had no idea I would like but the honey paired with cheese/almonds (to die for), Mary's chicken...the green bean was perfectly crunchy and spiced; chicken was tender and juicy. Bucatini (OMGosh) was it yummy...I don't usually choose pork over other meat but the waitress suggested it and I'm glad I listened (spagettii was al dente...which i love).

I was told per diem gets pretty cozy during HH, I'll have to return to give it a try and maybe then...it would deserve a 5star!
author: Vee V.

description:
Per Diem is lucky their Cioppino was mind blowing.....
Am usually patient but having to wait for abt an hour for a simple heirloom tomato salad and cioppino is ridiculous!!  Not good to keep a customer waiting - cuz I sat there contemplating the bad yelp review they were going to receive...lol

How they redeemed their stars back?
-CIOPPINO HEAVEN - rich broth that is perfectly spiced, shredded crab meat in every bite, and the rest of the seafood in the dish was super fresh.....hearty portion too!
-waitress was sweet and apologetic about the hiccup they had in their kitchen and offered dessert and coffee on the house
-nice, welcoming place with a great vibe & ambiance

Overall, I'd say 3.5 stars....edging at 4....
...I need to go back and try other dishes to see if they deserve the 4 stars - but seriously, try their Cioppino - you won't be disappointed!
author: Bhavnak K.

description:
I booked a table here for my Director so we could take a co-worker out to lunch. Pretty easy walk from 525 Market Street and we were seated right away. I had a 4 top on the second floor for per Diem and looked over the menu. I hadn't been here before but the others had and rattled off some suggestions to me.

I decided on a flat bread pizza, I think it was called the Margerita, and ordered a Caesar salad. The pizza was delicious but needed a fork and knife in order not to get the sauce all over my hands (not a good look when you are out in the FiDi). The salad was good as well and tasted fresh with house made croutons. 

I ended up taking about half of my flat bread back to work. The waitress was quick with taking our orders, bringing the food out, and the bill since we mentioned we were just out for lunch and had to get back to work in a quick fashion.

I will come back for sure, maybe for happy hour since everyone is adding yummy looking cocktails to their Yelp page!
author: Constance D.

description:
A table for two in cozy upstairs on a Friday after work? Yes, we scored that easily at Per Diem, making reservations the morning of. 

A cool, mahogany style, low-lit resto with a slightly nautical theme made for a unique setting. I'll get to the food in a moment. One of the best things about our experience was the staff. Our server was professional, fast, kind, no attitude and steered us well on the menu was asked questions about the driest white wine or better choice of appetizer.

The best thing was when I inquired about their Negroni special and she asked if I was interested in a traditional Negroni (which I was), then she'd direct me to their house-made cocktail, rather than the special listed. And she was right - it was a perfectly herbal experience, as I like my Negronis.

Mixed spring greens salad fed both of us. Bucatini ragu was spot on. Swordfish in a pistou was uniquely delicious. 

But the best part of our experience was truly our server - a top-notch pro who didn't rush us out the door, let us linger but also prompt with our requests. Thanks for a lovely Friday night out.
author: maureen f.

description: Great deco, feels like old Europe. The dishes were delicious. Leon, our server, was charming and witty! He made our lunch an enjoyable and fabulous experience.
author: Zaina O.

description:
The good:
Relaxing retro library law office setting; dark and classy
Cioppino seafood was excellent but the crab was missing (waitress should have mentioned they were out of crab; it was clearly listed in the description of the entree)

The bad:
Short rib, expensive and tasted very bland; was this microwaved?
Service was very slow

Just received our credit card bill and they changed the tip amount +$6. 12% seemed fair for the service but it appears they wanted more. So did we. Is this the way to expect return customers?
author: Daniel W.

description:
Highlights
- I've only dined in the downstairs portion and it was a very unique feeling with the rustic decor with wood finishes and steel beams. 
- We were seated near the kitchen area in high stools and booth like seating. Service was great. Very attentive and quick. 
- Lasagnette is house made daily and it was chicken the day that I came with a side of mixed greens and tomatoes with vinaigrette dressing. Glad it came with the salad because it was really rich and cheesy. 

Improvements
- The lasagnette did not taste like it contained any noodles, it was basically just cheesy gooey goodness with chunks of chicken. I love my carbs, but too much cheese makes me queasy. 

Tip
- They accept reservations on open table. If you plan to come for lunch, make a reservation, since it gets pretty busy during lunch time.
author: Tracy T.

description:
I was really excited to try this place out. I work in the Citigroup building, right across the street from Per Diem and it always looked popping during lunch time. Came here with some coworkers for one of our coworker's birthday.

Ambiance: Very nice, felt like I was on a classy, preppy ship, like from the 1800s. The upstairs dining area is super cute.

Service: Good, given the fact that it was prime lunch time, the waitress (forgot her name) was very attentive and checked up on our table plenty of times. 

Food: Ehhhh. I ordered the porcini mushroom parpadelle. It sounded like a stellar dish on paper (chard, roasted wild mushrooms, thyme-Parmesan broth, truffle oil and creme fraiche). Such luxurious ingredients...so I was thinking, this dish is the winner. The dish was a disappointment. There was WAY TOO MUCH truffle oil, it was extremely overpowering and I couldn't taste the lovely porcinis. I love truffle oil but there was just a lack of finesse in the truffle oil use...truffle oil should always be used carefully. The creme fraiche on top of the pasta seemed like a great concept, i just don't think it was executed correctly. And okay, there is a time and place for chopped green onions. But green onions on top of my pasta as a garnish?! No!!!!!! It doesn't work!!! I also wish they could've mentioned that the dish had chili peppers in it! I wasn't looking for a spicy, overly truffled mushroom pasta and that's exactly what I got. 

My first experience wasn't completely super effed up because of that parpadelle. The place is beautiful (filled with well-off fidi folks but it's coo) I will try the burrata or the bone marrow appetizers next time. But then again, what sounds great on paper could be a mess when you actually try it. We will see! Till next time, Per Diem.
author: Krysti R.

description:
Went here with a group of four people last night after a movie at the Metreon. Our reservation was at 8, and the restaurant was relatively quiet. The ambience was really nice, and the food was delicious. My one issue was our service, it was a little slow. Service aside, I would definitely go back. 

Shared Starters:

Poutine (LOVED it)
Pork Belly

Dinner:

lasagnette 
Pappardelle
New York Steak.

I personally had the pappardelle, and I found the dish comforting and satisfying. The bite that I had of my boyfriend's lasagnette was delicious.
author: Amber A.

description:
I had a fantastic lunch at Per Diem recently.  I love the look and style of the restaurant - it's very cool with wood walls, floors and steel beams, which I imagine are earthquake reinforcements.  The hostess was very friendly and welcoming, and brought us right to our table, which was a two top nestled in a corner with a window on Sutter Street.

Our waiter was charming and helpful, and brought us our drinks quickly and offered us the lunch specials.  I ended up with the Oyster Po-Boy, which was served with homemade pickled vegetables and my friend got the Ahi-Tuna Melt (supposed to be crab, but they had run out).  The Po-Boy was delicious.  I loved the aoili they used and the light and crunchy bun.  The only bad part was vegetables on the sandwich.  After a couple of bites I opened up the sandwich and they were all jalapenos - no wonder!  After I shoved them to the side the sandwich was much better.  My pal's Tuna Melt was fantastic and we shared the last couple of bites.

No time or room for dessert since it was lunch hour.  I plan to come back for dinner one night so I can try some of the inventive sounding cocktails and explore more of the menu.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Came here on Friday night at 8. Was pretty easy to get a reservation for 4 and not too packed. 

The staff was friendly and decor is beautiful. The ambiance is little on the quieter side.

I ordered the Halibut and it was very crispy, tender and fresh! Although the portion was a little on the small side, even for halibut.

Great place overall for groups.
author: Ray G.

description:
I'm just the IT guy and taste tester. My wife writes all the cools stuff

A couple days after Christmas we headed into San Francisco for a day and had dinner at Per Diem, based a friend's recommendation.

Located in the Financial District, Per Diem features an Italian and Californian influenced menu.  The exterior from the street is unobtrusive and its best that you know you're looking for a restaurant.

Upon entering it feels as though you step back in time to the age of San Francisco's early beginnings.  The decor is oversized and dark, warm and cozy, with hints of old world library.  It feels like a place, in which groups of men would retire to after an elaborate dinner, to have cigars and digestives.  Dark, warm wood, concrete walls, large old books, globes, and a wood and marble bar inhabitant the two-story restaurant.

The menu is a traditional Californian Italian menu -- starters, pizzas, salads, pastas and entrees.

We started with the Steamed PEI Mussels with Sausage and Crostone, along with the Burrata on a Grilled Crostone with local Marshall Farm's Honey, sea salt and toasted almonds.  The sausage adds a nice spicy kick to the briny sweet mussels and the crostone allows you to sop up the extra juices.  I loved the sea salt with the honey and cheese.  The Burrata is sweet, smooth and creamy while the honey offers a warm, amber sweetness and a nice textural difference, the sea salt helps combine the two beautifully.

We tried two salads.  The Panzanella with Bloomsdale Spinach combined orange, beets and lemon vinaigrette.  The panzanella added nice texture, soft centers but toasted with a slight crusty exterior, which allowed it to soak up some lemon vinaigrette.  The spinach was fresh and sweet.  We also ordered the Wedge Salad with buttermilk dressing and bacon lardons.  I love wedge salads, and don't know why I never make them at home.  They are simple, but seem very filling and substantial, even though its mostly iceberg lettuce.  I love the crisp, refreshing lettuce.  This buttermilk dressing had a wonderful balance of sweet and savory, with a hint of acidity, which helps the dressing feel a bit on the lighter side.

The meatball pizza is a great dish to order if they have it.  The sweet meatballs are sliced into rounds and placed on top of ricotta and cheese pizza.  The crust is thin and chewy, with a slight crispness.  The topping/crust ratio is excellent.

For the main entree I ordered the Papparadelle with Pork Ragu, beets and broccoli rabe.  I was a bit hesitant about the combination, since the beets are sweet, pork ragu tends to be on the sweeter side of savory and the broccoli rabe can be quite bitter.  But, it was something I've never thought to combine, so I gave it a whirl.  It was good, but I don't think I would combine the broccoli rabe with beets and ragu again.  I understand ingredients are used to balance flavors, but this combination didn't work for me.  I tasted each ingredient separately, but they didn't enhance one another, or complement one another.  I did love the pork ragu and the delicate pasta.

Overall it was a wonderful dining experience - service, atmosphere and food.  I will definitely return if the opportunity arises.
author: Chad G.

description: Excellence is hard work and tonight this restaurant fell short. This was our son's birthday so we were looking forward to a great evening and fine food. First they sat us downstairs right in front of the door and needless to say that it was not the warmest place in the venue. Then we waited over an hour for a steak that was barely cooked and a ciopino that was way too salty and spicy. Service was blah and frankly the whole dinner experience was a disappointment. It's a wannabe place, over designed and overpriced.
author: Tifenn D.

description: food was okay not bad got the pasta but definitely not vegetarian friendly.
author: Raymond H.

description:
There are many reasons to go to a financial district bar after work...great vibe, cocktails with fresh ingredients, happy hour menu or a guaranteed bar stool are just a few. Per Diem has all of these things (except for the guaranteed bar stool which can be scarce anytime between 4:30 and 8:00) but the real reason to go to Per Diem (and my 5 star rating) is for bartender Joe. Joe mixes a great cocktail. In addition to his skills behind the bar he brings the real reason to be a repeat customer at a financial district bar - personalized attention. He always remembers your name, shakes hands with people who stop by regularly and remembers the way you like your drink or suggestions improvements. 

Tip: Let him convince you to try a pickleback or a shot of chartreuse. Your night will go from drinks after work to FUN.
author: Debbie B.

description:
First of all- whatever you do, order the burrata crostone. You'll likely want to order another. It's so delicious.

I work near Per Diem and frequently visit for lunches, happy hours and dinners. 

I love everything I've ordered, and at this point have tried nearly the entire menu. The Porcini Mushroom Pappardelle is my favorite pasta, be sure to give that a try.

The service and staff are always very friendly- Brandon, Darren and the crew do a fantastic job making you feel welcome.

Food is served surprisingly fast, even during busy lunch and happy hour rushes. 

Do yourself a favor and visit Per Diem.  Cool ambiance, excellent service, and incredible food + drinks!
author: Alyssa D.

description: My friend and I came for drinks after work on a Tuesday. Waited ten minutes to be able to put our drink order in, waited another 10 minutes to get a beer and cocktail. We also ordered the burrata on a grilled crostini. What we got was a breakfast dish; one piece of toast with burrata and about 1/4 cup of honey for $11. It was good, but a little weird and especially not worth $11. Upstairs can be pretty loud and you can hear everyone else's conversations. The staff was very nice and attentive which is probably why we will come back.
author: Sarah F.

description: Made reservations 3 months ago. Bday dinner for 8 people . Where do they seat us ?? By the bar with high chairs.. Wtf  , anyways they had lamb shank on the menu . Waitress comes and take orders, I'm sorry we ran out last nite.... Like really, at least tell us ahead of time . Read a lot of good reviews on Yelp. I would never come back here and my friends would agree. Over hyped and staff is undertrained . Food is terrible and everything was over cooked, would rather have had Denny's . Per Diem sucks !! Don't dine here , I never post or rant about places but this is by far the worst dinner experience ever.
author: So V.

description:
Spacey & sophisticated eats--their margherita pizza was delish and their Old Fashioned was exactly how I like my men--strong. Through the grapevine, their pasta dishes are on point. Service is really friendly and are great at the oh-God-help-me-order game. 

Extra points for ambiance: dark wood, warm lighting, and antique dining furniture. First floor is great for small groups and chatter at the bar. Upstairs is a lot more intimate and romance-y. 

Overall great place to go with coworkers or friends for the FiDi crowd.
author: Kat L.

description: This review is based on a first time happy hour experience. The Manhattan was the best I've had - perfectly crafted. The only food I tried was the burrata and it was soft, salty and sweet. I'm def a fan of Per Diem.
author: Karen S.

description:
Mussels in Broth:  A
Served with dipping bread.  Very fresh and cooked very well.  Broth had a strong seafood flavor to it and was slightly spicy because of the sausage; tasted good enough to make me want to drink it!

Tagliatelle:  B+
Tagliatelle was cooked well.  Seems the pasta is handmade.  Sauce was identical to the broth served with the mussels.  Nothing special.

Pappardelle:  B+
Handmade wide flat pasta.  Again, seems handmade.  Great texture.  Sauce was a bit too heavy.  Was served with a pesto, fingerling potatoes, and goat cheese.  

Overall, a very good place.  Portions are extremeley generous for the price.
author: David C.

description: Great food and service.  The deocration is wonderful.  Coktails are a must.  So delicious.
author: M B.

description:
Yes, I realize I'm going to be the out-lier when it comes to reviews of Per Diem. I'm sorry. It just didn't blow me away.

Another Yelper mentioned, "Love the ambiance and the space!" (Agreed) "Sometimes I notice a restaurant's fancy exterior helps to distract from the inferior food...but not at Per Diem." (Disagree)

Per Diem is all about smoke and mirrors. The atmosphere is fantastic, and it would totally be a great place to grab a drink with a friend/colleague after work, but by-pass it when it comes to meal time.

My sister came over from the East Bay for meet me for dinner. We were celebrating her 21st birthday. We both had our hearts set on the Bucatini- and they were out of it. (Really? Friday night at 7 PM and you're out of pasta?!??!) The Carb-aholic in me died a bit that night, and I ordered the chicken. It was lack-luster. The service was ssssllllooooowwww.

I really wanted to like Per Diem- I thought it was indeed the whole package, but it proved otherwise. Perhaps it was an off night, but I'm not sure I'd be willing to give it another chance.
author: Annalise F.

description: This is definitely what I would call a little hidden gem. Right on the corner of Sutter near Market, it is my go-to if I am treating myself to an offsite lunch. The food and service is absolutely fantastic. They definitely know how to take care of their regulars and Monica never disappoints at the bar
author: Danae E.

description: Really nice atmosphere and staff. Food was very bland. I had ordered the ravioli and the favors were not very well balanced and some of ingredients were undercooked. Brussels sprouts were tasty but suffered from a little too much flavor from the sauce. In the end it seems like you pay more for the atmosphere than the food.
author: Cody W.

description: I've been wanting to come here for years but nothing ever lined up correctly so I'm glad I was able to try it out for a client lunch last week.  We sat upstairs and we were pretty close to the people next to us but we really couldn't hear their conversation which was nice.  I got the burger and thought it was prepared perfectly.  The horseradish aiolo gave it a nice kick.  I'd highly recommend the burger!
author: Blake B.

description:
Just came here for lunch with some friends. We made a reservation in advance so didst have to wait long at all. Looks like this place does get packed for lunch so be sure to get here a little early to beat the lunch crowd.

It's really easy to miss this place as you just see the huge doors and can't see that everyone is sitting very cozy inside enjoying their lunches. 

They have a simple menu with soup of the day, salads, light appetizers, pasta, sandwiches and pizza.

We got the burrata appetizer to split between us 4 gals and it was super delish! Loved the little bit of sweetness of the honey with the cheese and almond slices on top of a crispy crostini!

I was also able to split the crab melt with my friend and we added a side of truffle fries for an additional $2. The portions are pretty big for lunch. So glad I was able to share a sandwich with my friend as I wouldn't have been able to finish all of it myself. 

Still this place is a bit pricer as far as lunch options go in the fidi. more like $15 to $20 lunch. It's also more of a sit down place and it takes awhile to get your food so if you are having a working lunch meeting this would be the spot to go.

I hear they have an outdoor patio deck on the top floor so I will have to be back for dinner and happy hour for sure!
author: Christine W.

description: This is one of my go-to places in S.F.  They aren't great at the reception desk (often ignore you and there is often a wait beyond your scheduled reservation), but other than that I am always happy.  The service once seated is great and the food is delicious. I am sad they did away with the lasagne special of the day, but have been pelased with everything I have ordered there.  I shy away for business lunch, however, because of the host/hostess issues.
author: Hilary R.

description: Went to Per Diem with a group of people and had the worst service I have ever experienced in any restaurant. Asked the waitress 3 times for our French fries and never came. Waitress was absolutely horrible. Then dinner came and my pasta was Luke warm. That sucked after waiting 45 minutes for dinner to show up. Other people in our party were so pissed about the service that they left and went to eat elsewhere. I ended up eating the roasted chicken that someone ordered but left and the chicken was quite good. So I would give higher marks for the food but the service was so bad I can't give Per Diem anything more than 1 star.
author: C L.

description: Super cute, trendy little place on Sutter street.  I had dinner here my last night in the city.  Great ambiance, mellow vibe, nice bar area, and then a separate dining area upstairs if you want to be in a more secluded, quieter area.  Perfect place for a date night!  The service was excellent. The food was good.  I wouldn't say out of this world or rave on and on about it.  But it was good.  I enjoyed my dinner.
author: Lora H.

description: If you haven't stopped in you definitely should. Went here on a date last week and the ambiance upstairs is amazing. Very cool drink and wine menu. Really unique selections! We had a couple apps dinner and dessert. The filet mignon with lobster fries was incredible as was the prosciutto flatbread. Service was great and management stopped by multiple times during our experience. We felt really spoiled. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Richard P.

description:
Per Diem was good. The food was great, however we left hungry (maybe that's us, not sure?).

Being a new restaurant, they are still working out a few kinks. I would be interested to see the lights a little dimmer, the music a little quieter and just a little more polished. 

I enjoyed my dinner there, but am interested to see how they settle in to their look and feel before going back again.
author: Katie M.

description: The drinks were good. The service was good. The sides to my pork chop were yummy. But the pork chop was inedible. Tough to cut and chew. I kept having to oh so discretely spit out pieces because I just couldn't get through it. I didn't send it back as I was having too much fun chatting with my friend, but I should have. I wonder if any of the staff noticed the wreck of a chop left on my plate?
author: Susan S.

description:
3.5 star review

Good

- super yummy cocktails (dark & stormy is really tasty and therefore dangerous)
- excellent flat bread (what's the difference between pizza and flat bread?)
- happy hour special included oysters
- swanky decor
- prompt and efficient service (We had exactly 1.25 hours to drink and eat, and we managed to eat 4 dishes and 4 drinks, pay the bill and get out the door on time. Yay!)
- location (right next to bart station)

Not so good

- very limited seating (I got there at 5:15 and all the seats were taken. I got lucky because one party happened to leave but I would have had to leave for another place if that table didn't become available...)
- host asking me if i was going to order food or just drink...(does that mean i am not allowed to sit at a table if i don't want food? not a problem for me since i never drink without mounds of food but still)
- happy hour ends early (6pm)

I can see this place being one of my regular happy hour hangouts but I will probably try to get here early to snag a table.
author: Su K.

description:
Pros:Solid food & price. 
Casual dining downstairs, more formal upstairs. 
You can even make lunch reservations for 2 on open table. 

All the food I've ordered turned out delicious. I love every fresh pasta dish they have on the menu!

Only downside: I wish they have more variations on the menu. After coming here numerous times, the menu did get a little predictable & running out of excitements to order.
author: Yum Y U M.

description: I found this place by accident and am very glad I came in.  Monica was great behind the bar and made an excellent Old fashioned.  I didn't have anything to eat, but the food looked good.   I will try the food next time and will definitley be back for another drink and great service by Monica.
author: Kelley S.

description:
What drives me nuts is that they will call you the day before to confirm the reservation but if you need to call them back and change anything you get an outgoing message with no choices to leave a voice message - you may only respond by email. 

I'm sorry, I'm an adult, not a child.

I had a reservation for lunch tomorrow and 3 dinner reservations over the next few weeks. I've cancelled them all. If you can't answer the phone or let a guest leave a message I simply cannot be bothered to dine at your establishment.
author: Hotel B.

description: Per Diem has a really unique atmosphere.  The theme is "old financial district" or "old money"...with all sorts of interesting artifacts around the restaurant. I was particularly fond of the service and the food was really great. I had the pork ragu and a Dry Creek Zin. The desserts and starters are small, so get a couple of each if you intend to share. Would definitely eat here again the next time I'm in town.
author: Gabe M.

description:
I liked this place and would come back, notwithstanding that I didn't like my entree. 

Restaurant has a cool, stylish interior and kinda looks like if a restoration hardware catalog became a restaurant. We were able to get a group reservation the day of, even though the place was crowded. Seated immediately, service was prompt and friendly. 

I ordered the salmon which was fairly bland and underwhelming, as I tend to find with most restaurants in the city. Do not order this if you're hungry, as it's not filing. Friends ordered the chicken, risotto, and duck confit pizza, and everyone thought their food was well done. Tried some of the duck confit pizza and it was delicious. I would definitely come back to try that.
author: Ronnie S.

description: I was going to meet my girlfriend for dinner after work one night...she had to work later than usual, so I waited for her at the bar. It's always kind of intimidating approaching a crowded bar area...but, the bartenders were super nice and worked quickly & efficiently. Grace recommended a couple of cocktails that were just so creative and yum--I had the Teely Peach and the Smoking Mule! Loved the decor in there and they made me feel at home, so I didn't even mind that my gf was late. Will definitely return soon! =)
author: Michelle C.

description:
Went here for a company dinner - arrived at about 5pm and it was fairly empty (except for the bar area). Got a nice table upstairs, and our server came over pretty quickly to say hi and take our drink order. We got a variety of drinks (wine, pimms, whiskey drinks) and everyone was very happy with them. 
The waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful, and was able to provide several options for the vegan in the group. 
The food was overall very delicious. The table ordered a wide variety of things (salad, poutine, lasagna, seafood, cioppino) and everyone left the restaurant full and happy.
It was pretty busy when we were leaving (6:30pm) so make a resevation if you're going aoround that time!
author: Ariana L.

description:
This 2-star rating is directly connected to the experience I had with the waitstaff of this establishment. Here's the story: My sister and I were in the city to pick up our Nike Women's Marathon race packets in Union Square. My sister wanted to grab an early dinner so I quickly Yelped "Italian" restaurants near Union Square. After perusing the offerings, I decided to give Per Diem a try. Fit the bill at being close by, somewhat casual, and having Italian fare (pasta/pizza). 

We walked in at 5:00 p.m. and the bar seemed comfortably lively with a crowd that looked like they worked in the Financial District (which I expected). I walked up to the hostess stand, where the two hostesses were giggling and one was busy plugging in her iPhone. They glanced disinterestedly at me and my sister. I gamely stood there until one of the them finally looked over and said, "Hey. What's up?" REALLY?!? I was a bit dumbfounded at her greeting- typically the standard hostess greeting is "Hello! How can I help you?" I asked, "Do you have a table for two?" She glanced around and said seriously, "Umm. We're REALLY busy right now." I continued, "So, are you taking reservations?" She said, " It's open seating anywhere you can find it".  I glanced up at the stairway that led upstairs to my right. "What about up there?" "Oh!" she said. "Yeah, that's for dinner only." I looked at her and said, "Yea. We'd like to eat". This changed her tune. She chirped, "OH! Yea, there's lots of tables upstairs". Success!

We were taken to our table in a mostly empty dining room (I counted two other two-tops in a room that had 15-20 tables?) The waiter appeared instantly and took my drink order. After we had ordered food, he asked for the menus back. I asked him if I could keep the drink menu as I was probably having a second drink. He said "No problem". However, each time he came to the table, he attempted to take it back and I had to remind him that I wished to keep it (it's not like there were other tables needing an extra menu). 

During the short wait for our food, my sister and I opened our race packets and started looking through the swag in the bag. The food (an organic greens salad and mushroom pizza) arrived. We moved some of our stuff to the two-top next to us and dug in. The salad and pizza were very good. After we were half-way through, the waiter came by and said, "You're going to have to move your stuff. I'm seating this table". Then he grabbed my drink menu and left. When he came back, I questioned, "Why would you seat THIS table (indicating the table next to ours) when ALL these other tables are empty?? Just curious!?" And he said, "Oh in about 5 minutes, this WHOLE place will be PACKED."  Wow, I was impressed. "OK", I said, and I moved my things. Funny thing was, we stayed for 20 more minutes and the table was NEVER seated. And a total of 2 other couples were seated in the meantime but at tables miles away in a [still] mostly empty dining room. As we paid the bill, I asked him why the place was still pretty empty and the table to us was still not being used. He shrugged and said, "Well, you know how it is, everyone is waiting on other people. Believe me, this place will get packed." 

It's an understatement that I'm not impressed by this place. Food was good but there's WAY too many great restaurants in the city to put up with this pretentious crap.
author: Wendy N.

description:
Food: Solid to good italian. I had a couple of good pasta dishes (the pesto one was really good.)

Ambience: Very cool restaurant. I feel like I'm in an old ship/library. Make sure you have reservations. 

Cocktail hour: Ridiculously packed. There are a lot of FiDi suits. Get there at 5 and you should be fine. Great cocktails.
author: Clogozm C.

description:
I've been here twice mainly for the proximity to my office. My pasta looked and tasted great, but was extremely greasy. There were also a couple of fruit flies floating above our food, which can be quite distracting and unappetizing.

Others in my party had okay food as well, and they got an order wrong.

Not the best and not the worst, but I don't think I'll be coming back again.
author: Elly F.

description:
Definitely a great place to come for apps and drinks. Their wonderful post-modern, sort of edwardian feel of the decor and imaginative bar setup gives the ambiance a steampunk flair. Very cool edge to your downtown SF experience.

The bartenders and servers are friendly and knowledgable, and more than willing to recommend drink combinations and accompanying small plates to pair for the perfect night out.

Definitely a must if you're looking at a way to spice up your SF drinking adventure, I will definitely go back.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Common things I've heard here:

"Do you have a reservation?"
"We're closing."
"Looks like I don't see a table for you. Sorry."

This is despite always spotting empty tables. I've also never tried to go here after 8 p.m. I'm not a caveman; I know how to make a reservation. But this place looks like a work lunch or after-work drinks spot, not a place I should make special plans to visit.

Having said that, I had lunch here today at the bar and it was pleasant enough. Boyfriend's fries were a good portion, crispy, and they came with aioli and ketchup. My chicken Caesar salad had freshly grilled meat and a smattering of lettuce. Prices were not worth the experience. I paid $5 for the "champagne of ice tea," which came in a store-bought bottle. To make an Arnold Palmer with it -- which involves a simple task of filling half the glass with lemonade and then pouring the tea -- they charged an extra dollar. If you brought me half a glass of lemonade, I could do the rest.

I'm a frequent diner at Boudin down the street, which makes their salads daily in a vat. Per Diem, then, has an edge because of the freshness of their food. Was it worth $13 more? Definitely not. I doubt I'll be back, but you never know.
author: David S.

description:
LOVED this little spot! Very classy and intimate, and not a bad walk-in wait on a weekday. We started with the crispy pork belly, split the beet salad and ended with the sausage ragu pasta. The pork belly was fantastic - SUPER fatty, soft and flavorful. The salad was a respectable size (always nice at places like this) and extremely delicious. The pasta was a bit on the salty side but had a good chew; still, I'd probably try a non pasta entree next time.

Didn't have space for dessert but they looked delectable.
author: Judy L.

description:
First off, this place is right in the middle of downtown. Perfect for happy hours. Great atmosphere and delicious appetizers. I especially loved the meatballs and Caesar salad. So refreshing, crisp and left me wanting more!

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an amazing happy hour/dinner spot!!
author: Aimee R.

description: Had a lovely work dinner here last week. Was five of us, and they had our table ready as soon as we arrived. Was a little worried when we first walked in, it was really loud downstairs- but luckily they seated us upstairs where it was much quieter. Everyone enjoyed the food - I had the halibut, it was fresh and light. I'll definitely be back. Just ask to sit upstairs if you want to hear the dinner conversation.
author: Allie H.

description:
Went to Per Diem for lunch with a group of 6. In a few words - good food, terrible service. 

We really enjoyed the lunch - collectively, we ordered the Mary's chicken, a sandwich and soup, a pizzetta and the cioppino. The chicken and cioppino got high praise - very flavorful and great portions as well. We also ordered the slightly overpriced but yummy Arnold Palmers - the Republic Darjeeling iced team came in a massive bottle and you add the lemonade, served seperately, according to your taste. 

However, the service was uniformly terrible. We had to hail down our waitress for our initial orders (lunch group so we didnt have a lot of time). However, we barely saw her again - she served us our food but did not once check in on us. I was served the cioppino w/o a mussel fork and no vessel to hold the empty shells (had to hail her down to ask for one). Then, she cleared the table while one of my friends was still working on her drink - didnt even ask if she was done. 

Since it was a group of 6, we were automatically charged a 20% gratuity. We paid our checks but went down to complain to the hostess / manager that the service was lacking. This is where it gets worse - the manager did nothing to  make our experience any better. Note to hostess/manager: the whole point of patrons mentioning an issue is so you can make the experience better before they leave the restaurant. Telling a patron that you will talk to the server does not make them feel better about paying 20% for crappy service and does nothing to improve the current experience. 

At this stage, I will vote with my wallet and choose not to go back to Per Diem (and encourage others not to), unless, the restaurant can make better amends than offering to  "talk to the server".
author: Rumesha A.

description:
I've been here twice for lunch - the first time I had the chicken and the second time the bucatini (thanks fellow Yelpers for the suggestion) and both were delicious. 

Haven't got any complaints about the service - it wasn't the warm and fuzziest service I've ever had, but neither was it unfriendly, and it was certainly appropriately efficient for a lunch-hour. 

Maybe they hired some better servers? Perhaps lunch-hour is the time to come here?
author: Mi M.

description: Where do I begin? From calling to make a reservation to paying the check, Per Diem was nothing short of amazing. My boyfriend and I were coming off a dreamy weekend in Napa and dinner at Per Diem was truly the cherry on top of a perfect weekend. I can only hope BRANDON will see this one day and if I could hug you and tell you that you made our evening, I would. So now that you know the ambience & service is 5 star, the food is equally as amazing. Just trust me when I say, order the beet salad + Brussel sprouts + lamb entree. Do yourself a favor and next time you find yourself in The City, visit Per Diem.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Great, mellow vibe for a casual, moderately priced dinner. 

I've been for dinner 3 times (once with my wife and twice with big groups) and every time the service has been excellent, the cocktails have been on point, and everyone has enjoyed the food. The salumi platter, local green salad, pasta and pizzas have all tested well.

If you're in the area and looking for a good date spot or place to get together with friends, Per Diem won't disappoint.
author: Patrick W.

description:
I've gone here for drinks before, but this was my first dining experience. Wowza I was impressed! A friend and I shared the meatball pizza, the local greens salad, and the burrata appetizer. Every dish was fantastic - the pizza was surprisingly light but very tasty, and even the salad far exceeded my expectations. But the burrata...oh boy, I will be back for you, burrata deliciousness!

Love the ambiance there as well - the bar is fun for a general post-work cocktail, but the upstairs was like being in a secret, fancy library...very different and fun.

All around, very impressed and will absolutely be back. Bummed I haven't tried it sooner!
author: Megan S.

description:
My Oh My!  Per Diem's Mary's Chicken did me RIGHT! 

How do they do it? The chicken had practically no bones - nothing to discard into a napkin on the sly.  I don't get it, but I won't question.
I don't know what in heaven is in the light brown sauce they pour on this juicy, white meat, but it had my taste buds screaming in the sexiest way.

The bouncy ball shaped potatoes were two bites of yummyness each and served well to soak up excess sexy sauce.  

If you got a little warm after reading about the main course, I'm going to have to spare you the passionate talk about the chocolatey, gooey dessert..

On your down the street, keep your eyes peeled for the door.  Per Diem's "sign" is not in the typical place hanging sideways over the door for you to see from the sidewalk. We passed it.. then went down a hallway and in a door that wasn't officially the entrance. 

It is a pretty darn small place for how awesome it is, but the decor is gorgeous; classy and sophisticated, yet not too much for comfort.  Despite it not being a large restaurant, a group is doable - as we had 20+ upstairs.  Splendid service, appealing date-vibe.. and the lighting, on a scale of 1- being coffin and 5-cafeteria, is about a 2.5. 

Oh but SPORTS!  Dudes, no worries. Take your lovely for a nice dinner and peep the the game over her shoulder (Unless your date is moi.  Didn't your mama raise you better?) It's still a bar and there's a couple flat screen TVs (on which we caught Game 1 in the world series - Go Giants!)
author: Heidi P.

description:
I can't seem to find a good reason not to give this place 5 stars, but I like to think I'm picky so it's gets a very strong 4.

I had the rabbit, which was a mix of rabbit confit ravioli and seared rabbit loin. Very tender and light. My friend's pork osso bucco was also incredible and would have been my second pick.

We ate at the bar given our last minute decision on a Saturday night, but it was actually perfect and very quiet. 

Finally, I love the space. I was supposed to have a birthday party here last year at their soft opening, which unfortunately was cancelled, so I suppose that's the only thing keeping me from giving them 5 stars, but they may be able to redeem themselves after one more dining experience.

This would be a great first date spot (sitting at the bay anyway) for either drinks or dinner. It's quiet and low-lit enough to be romantic, yet not overly formal or forced.

Will be back for sure.
author: Alex H.

description: For a no nonsense, convenient location for a Financial District happy hour--a good spot. Still a lil pricy for happy hour, but not too bad.
author: Mel G.

description: This place sucks -- we came here for dinner on a Saturday night and service was SOOOOO SLOOOOOOOW despite the place being practically empty. The waiter also accidentally charged us the entire bar tab... with nothing but an apology... Food was decent but not worth the wait. Would not come back or recommend this place, at least for a weekend (perhaps service operations is better during the week/catered to the work crowd).
author: Shirley L.

description:
This place looks really nice, thought it might be decent. However, my experience was far from nice. First off, I ordered a glass of Nebiolo, but they gave me a glass of Nero d'Avola instead. The server didn't write down our orders, and I thought I was being pretty clear when I told him what I wanted. Not sure if he didn't hear me or because he put in the wrong order because he forgot and just entered something. There was no one sitting at the surrounding tables so it wasn't even noisy! No idea what went wrong there.

Second, we got our apps, that were alright. Got a marrow that tasted like it was not seasoned at all. Then comes entree. We were just finishing up our apps, the server comes by and goes, "oh perfect timing", clears our tables and someone comes over to drop off entrees, but for the wrong person. They clearly didn't wait for us to finish before sending us our next course. Are they in a hurry to kick us out?

I ordered a porcini mushroom papperdelle. There were no porcini mushrooms on the plate. Instead, there were maitake mushrooms instead. HUGE difference. Next, the menu listed there is truffle oil in the dish. Absolutely none. And lastly, there is no salt in the dish. Did they forget to salt too? On top of no truffle oil and giving me a mushroom that isn't what was supposed to be in it? The pasta itself also tastes like store bought dried pasta. It's one thing to buy dried pasta but clearly the dish was so bad that I could distinguish the difference.

Worst service ever and false advertisement. Don't ever come here. You're wasting your time and money.
author: Stephy Y.

description:
Was here recently & had an amazing experience! They have a great cocktails and really cool space. Perfect for just drinks or dinner as well. 

Will definitely be returning!
author: Carlynn A.

description:
I am a little suprised why people think this place has great food - well, people are different and have different taste, I guess.

I came here on a welcoming lunch with my new coworkers. And let me tell you, I was a little disappointed. I had expected great food and a great sesrvice - I got niether of that. I had ordered pasta - a plain pasta with the OVER-PEPPERED sauce. With every spoon taken, I had to drink water. Def, was not a pleasant experience. My co-worker had ordered a salad. It took them 30-35 minutes to make a salad. I understand we were not the only ones to be served during the lunch time. However, I would expect the salad to come before the pasta comes (pasta was served first). 

Although, I didn't enjoy the meal there, I def enjoyed the atmosphere. The interior design is gorgeous and very interesting. 

I am not convinced to visit this place again. Sorry.
author: Jenna F.

description:
I had a last minute business meeting in the FiDi and needed a lunch spot to impress our guests. We showed with no reservations and with a packed crowd, I was afraid we would be stuck. The hostess was a rockstar in helping get us past the crowd and upstairs to a table. And the decor - better than what was described. It's certainly a nice departure from the trend of overly contemporary places that look as if they were second hand Vegas designs. Per Diem felt like you were walking into someone's home.

Having read about some of the other customer experiences, I was expecting rude, curt and unprofessional service - it couldn't have been further from the truth. The staff made every effort to ensure we were well taken care of and were über friendly. If you're expecting a stiff-upper-lip kind of service where the place has no personality beyond its 'celebrity chef' then go elsewhere. Per Diem is a solid spot that doesn't take itself seriously but takes their service seriously.

We had two courses - starting with the Burrata; a simple dish but with a rich portion of cheese and the honey made it pop... we ordered a second. I had the burger and it was as good as, if not better, than Nopa's. I know, it's a tall order, but you can tell that Chef Adam really takes pride in his work.

This may just be my new favorite spot downtown and considering a pretty amazing drink menu, I'd say happy hour is in order very soon.
author: Brad J.

description:
I made reservations for 5:30 pm on a Friday. I love the favor of their food. I think the portions can be a bit bigger though.

Between 3 people we shared:
1) Short Ribs - Favorite
2) Lasagnette
3) Cippino 

The short ribs was our favorite. The cippino only came with two slices of bread. We asked for more bread and it never came out. So we just got the check. Our waitress got us some dessert wine instead since the bread was never brought out. I'm surprise that they did not have any bread or olives for each table. The food came out kind of slow also. Other than that the I would come again and try their happy hour.
author: V N.

description: My go-to for entertaining clients. Food is good, drinks are better, and if you get  seat upstairs, it is relatively quiet which makes it the perfect place for business dinners and lunches.
author: Ashley L.

description:
Really liked their homemade pasta.  We ordered 2 and both had really good pasta but the sauces/toppings varied in quality.  The bucatini bolognese was terrific!  The other was a lighter mixed vegetable with bacon.  It was the day's special and sounded really good but the bacon was soft and a bit too chewy.  So we ended up not liking it too much.

The decor is very nice (a bit on the dark side) but relatively upscale.  We went on a Saturday early evening and the place was not very busy.  I think its location being in the Financial District probably draws more business during weekday lunches.
author: Hui C.

description:
Although, Per Diem doesn't offer an array of options, the restaurant does have a few but worthwhile dishes worth trying.

I would highly recommend the buccatinni- it was really yummy with the right amount of savory and rich flavor in the sauce. I really also appreciated the ambiance of PD, it was decorated with dark mahogany wood and dim lighting which provided a warm and intimate atmosphere. Our waiter was very knowledgable also, which is helpful because I'm not that familiar with italian dishes. 

I will probably give Per Diem another shot in the near future.
author: C M.

description: nice wines, good cocktails, food pretty good too. Great place to go with friends or a date. Although reservations are a good idea you can still walk in and get a table but might have to wait 30 mins.
author: Kristan B.

description:
The food here was good, and in most cities in the country this would be a great restaurant. Unfortunately for the owners, the category (caliornia new american) is very crowded with some outstanding names, so it's hard to make a big splash.

I wouldn't specifically recommend Per Diem, but there is nothing bad to say about it either. If you are looking for a straight forward, good quality menu, it's a good choice.

The bar is above average in quality, though from what I could see, perhaps below average in stock selection. (maybe they have a back area with more bottles)
author: Ryan R.

description:
I had high hopes for this place with an interesting menu and great location.

Unfortunately the food was mediocre to just plain bad and the service was terrible. There are lots of other great restaurants out there.
author: t. e.

description:
I walked past Per Diem on my way home from work for the longest time and never stopped in.  My job is high impact with long hours and a huge emotional impact, so I am usually rushing to get home after an exhausting 16 hour day.  That said, one day, after a particularly grueling day of my boss being extra stressful, I stopped in for happy hour with a couple of my friends and their Old Fashioned changed my life.  Everyone on YELP keeps raving about the food, but I think their bartenders and mixologists really need a call out for their excellent taste, and perfect pours.  It's crazy to me that such a simple cocktail could be that much better than other places, but it is just true.  This started my on an after-work spiral trying each of their wonderful concoctions over the following few weeks without disappointment.  Try any drink off their menu.  Trust me. 

On to the food.  Apparently they are well known for their pasta dishes, but I'm not really a pasta person, so I have yet to try one.  I know my friends who have tried the dishes have been happy.  That said, the reason for my delay is because the first time I went I tried the poutine and the brussel sprouts and these two dishes are so spectacular I have yet to try something else.  One day I hope to pull myself away from them long enough to try and order something else.  (Or maybe I'll just rent the place out for a birthday party and try a little bit of everything.  Apparently there are people who do this. Next step, make more friends...)  One day I hope to stop stuffing my face with Poutine long enough to try the rest of the menu but we'll just have to wait and see how well my self-control is...

The ambiance and decor is perfect for a downtown bar.  You get the suit and tie crowd after work, but the laid back, friendly work-staff has always given me a comfortable feel.  I always feel at home and relaxed here.  Perfect place for either meeting friends or a serious business drink.

Ps.  Order the poutine!
author: Justin H.

description:
I really liked the decor.  Lots of wood, dark colors, modern lighting; sort of reminds you of an old boy's club 

The service was great and then dropped off when they got busy.  I think it would have been fine if we hadn't taken so long to order our entrees.

I can't compliment the food...  We tried the barrata and the cheese plate appetizers (the barrata was underwhelming; the cheese plate had unique cheeses/pairings but they didn't seem to go together ie. soft smoky cheese w/ coco pistachio butter?). I had the Orecchiette for my entree... the noodles looked like ravioli but weren't stuffed (just a thick under-cooked noodle!); I thought the sauce was pretty good.

I would go back for a drink.
author: Kerry P.

description:
Spend it here.

Formerly an unassuming sandwich and smoothie shop. Transformed into an eclectic, buzzing and downright delicious mecca.

Remodel is impressive for anyone who had been to the previous incarnation. Dark wood sets a moody and alluring vibe. Almost of another era.

People are flocking. We had a reservation. We had to wait. And wait some more.

But when we were seated it was all worth it.

Toast topped with burrata, honey and wallets was more dessert less appetizer. 

Shrimp cocktail is served with a homemade cocktail sauce with a kick.

Turkey on ciabatta bursts with flavor from the meat, apple slices, slaw and spicy mustard. Outstanding.

Service was confident and prompt. Had time for our meal and back in time for a meeting despite the wait.

If lunch was this good I can only imagine how epic dinner must be.

Just try to come on someone else's dime. Ambiance and food comes at a price (thus the loss of a fifth star). Bit expensive for lunch.

Granted the sandwich and burrata toast were both priceless.
author: Jason B.

description: what a fabulous night out! started with the seasonal vegetables, which were cooked to perfection. followed by the charcuterie that was a bountiful selection of meat, cheese, breads and pickled vegetables. i enjoyed the duck for my entree and topped off my meal with the creme brulee. i appreciated the creaminess and that is was topped with real whipped cream. not only was each course delightful, but the staff were welcoming and the atmosphere is incredible.
author: Luann R.

description:
At first glance of the storefront, you'd never think that this was a restaurant.  When I first entered, I expected an antique store.  My friend, a frequent lunch customer, brought me here for a Good Friday lunch.  We were led to their upstairs dining room and seated in the back, away from the window.  Familiar with the menu, my friend immediately ordered two appetizers to share as we studied the lunch entrees.  We both ordered the crab melt, except that I changed the salad accompaniment to the soup (french fries are the other option).  
A short time later, the two appetizers came piping hot.  The mussels were served with three toast wedges and ground sausage pieces in a tangy broth.  The fritto misto comprised of a generous portion of battered calamari, shrimp, and fish pieces, served with lemon wedges.  
We just finished the appetizers when the sandwiches arrived.  The sandwich was cut in three triangles with a cup of Minestrone set on one side of the plate; the crab filling was tasty and garnished with some cooked red peppers.  I could not finish it and brought one triangle home.  The food quality was four-star worthy.  
The dining room is pretty dark and the noise level can get a bit loud, as mentioned in Michael Bauer's review a week later; the service was also a bit uneven (minus 0.5 star).  The lunch menu ranges from $10.00 to $14.00 for the most part which is reasonable for this part of town. Being an avid lasagna fan, they have a daily special, which was chicken today, but it didn't sound particularly interesting.  Hope it's a mushroom one my next trip here.  3.5 stars.
author: Mike C.

description:
Definitely one of my top go-to's for lunch!

Service can be a bit slow especially during the lunch rush, so make sure to give yourself ample time.

YAYS:
+ Fries w/ truffle oil
+ Steamed PEI Mussels
+ Dungenous Crab Melt (I didn't try it but my friends liked it)

NAYS:
none so far! :)

TIP: go early!!
author: Kristen C.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday evening with reservations we made earlier that day. Cute atmosphere and we sat upstairs (on a warm SF day- yikes the heat). Overall the experience was great, food was reasonably priced, and delicious. 
We brought our own bottle of wine and there was no cork fee-nice. My boyfriend tried a Caesar salad as a starter and the dressing was rather strong, which our server switched it out in no time with pleasure. They were attentive as well!
author: Linda L.

description:
I thought it was pretty ok.  The ambience was great,  although I thought the tables were so close to each other, it was difficult to talk because of the very loud group next to our table. 
They get pretty full during lunch so make reservations beforehand.  The pork gratin and the spinach pasta was good.  Service was good as well.  Good place to go if you want something better than your usual lunch fare.
author: Cj P.

description:
Met some old coworkers for lunch. Not too crowded for prime time which is fine by me. We had a nice window seat and we settled in and decided to share the burrata and I tried the crab melt. 

Burratta was tasty though all I tasted was the honey  but it was nicely cut up in three large pieces so that we could share it nicely. My crab melt was pretty good - though the bread was soggy I liked the crab taste with the veggies for the crunch. I love their fries at Per Diem - specifically the aioli they serve it with. Delicious!!

I'd come back again, but the meal is probably a little more expensive than what I'd like to spend here.
author: Julie F.

description:
The boyfriend and I came here for dinner one night after happy hour with his co-workers. We both walk past this restaurant all the time and we didn't know what to think of it.  Admittedly the name, Per Diem, is a little...I dunno, too financial districty?  The boyfriend was more eager to try this place than me since he always sees a line there and figured it must be good.  I just assumed it might be some business man trap since it was a "nice' restaurant in the area to take your co-workers/clients.

We started with a winter squash pizzetta which was fantastic!  We then shared a buccatini pasta.  I really really liked the buccatini.  I feel like a lot of pasta dishes are overly salted and this was just right for me.  We ended the night with some gelato.  YUM YUM YUM!

We're going to make a lunch date soon here because we both are pretty excited about it too!
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
I am so happy to share this review with all of you. The food is simply scrumptious the place is very sexy. Two levels... the first floor has a gorgeous bar.. the second level is the main dinning room (I loved it) superb service and if you go please try at least these items.:

*Burrata on a grilled crostone (delicious) 
*Bucatini (a bit spicy but yummy)
*Margherita Pizzetta (OMG sooo good) 

 I had dinner just last night and I can't wait to go back.!
author: Ernesto C.

description:
My wonderful friends came here to surprise me for my birthday (!), so Per Diem is definitely near and dear to me.

-I was extremely impressed by the wait staff's handling of our 16 person table. ALL entrees arrived at the same time (as all entrees should arrive at the same time): very cool. They were very patient as we sat for hours and took forever to order and eat and pay :-).
-Food was unfortunately not a primary point of focus for me, but the menu looked nice and Italian. Here's a quick rundown of what I tried: raw oysters, pizzettas, champagne, osso bucco, GIANT slice of dessert cake that was impossible to finish.

A wonderful 23rd birthday!
author: Daniel H.

description:
I came here with the best intentions. I really wanted to like it, but it was an EPIC fail!

The cute seating area upstairs and my company were the only two positives of my dining experience at Per Diem. 

First off, I know that as a veg head I can't expect restaurants to cater to my non meat eating dietary restrictions. However, I've never had a restaurant be more unaccommodating than Per DIem. When asked about vegetarian pasta options, the waitress said, 'Well all the pastas have meat in them, but if you really have your heart set on a pasta... I guess we can give you the tagliatelle dressed in pesto." Seriously? You expect me to pay $20 for that? The chef can't throw in a few mushrooms? Heck, I'll even take a few peas, anything.
 
Nonetheless, even after that convincing statement from our waitress, I opted against the pasta and settled for a vegetarian pizza. It was some potato, leek or celery concoction. Not seasoned at all and lackluster at best. 

Oh wait, don't let me forget the horrible appetizer we ordered. Whatever you do DO NOT order the 'Burrata on a Grilled Crostone.' It was terrible. Just picture a store bought piece of bread with mozzarella, slivered almonds and honey smothered on top. Ok so maybe everything minus the store bought bread sounds good, but trust me it was the worst excuse for an appetizer that I've ever seen. Especially at a restaurant that has the gall to charge $10 for a piece of bread!!!

Overall bad restaurant, especially for vegetarians!
author: Reena P.

description: I went for happy hour and ordered 2 drinks and 3 appetizers. Everything was delicious with the use of top notch quality ingredients. I have high standards, fyi. I love SF food! Enjoy this quaint place!
author: Carenna W.

description:
Here's how you're going to impress that girl/guy who works on the whatever floor (that is hopefully different from yours, so as to avoid any awkward "Are you dating?" conversations with your coworkers) who you always exchange glances with on the elevator. Make reservations for 2 at Per Diem via OpenTable, but when you ask your mutual admirer out, don't mention that this place really is fine dining. It sounds more casual, less date-y. Say you chose it because it's never too loud or rowdy but it's not a snob's affair by any means, and it's convenient to the Montgomery BART station. If your date asks what kind of bar they have, tell him/her that the drinks are fantastic, but beer and a great selection of wines are available, too. Ask if a table in the front window would be possible when you make your reservation.

Don't try to be the hot shot foodie who knows everything there ever is or was to know about food, wine, and booze, it's not impressive. Instead, ask your server and the sommelier for the specials and recommendations. They are both happy to go into loving detail about what's happening on the menu, so just let them do the talking at this point. Think twice about ordering anything that may be difficult to eat with a fork, except for maybe the burrata with honey and hazelnuts, which is just too good to pass up (and if you order any seafood including mussels or oysters, don't even THINK about using the word "aphrodisiac" at ANY point in the night...ugh). 

End the night with a recommended dessert wine. Plan on throwing down some real cash for the night. Though you can easily spend somewhere around $100 for dinner and drinks for two, it's a small price to pay for what you ultimately hope will lead to a second date.
author: Kat E.

description:
They really took the time to put together a great place with incredible ambiance.  The one drink I ordered from the bar was also good. I would suggest going for drinks, but not dinner.

We ordered 2 appetizers, two entrees, a coke, tea+tip = $100. For $100 with out alcohol, I do have a certain expectation from the food I order.   The pork belly appetizer was over cooked and the rest of the dish was bland, except for tomatoes which were over seasoned.  The burrata on crostone was good, but having had a similar dish a month ago elsewhere for $5 vs. $10(which was as good if not better), it left me underwhelmed and disappointed.

As for the main dishes, the Osso Bucco had zero flavor. Osso Bucco is a favorite dish of mine and when you have no flavor from any of the ingredients, it is so disappointing.  The chicken was ok, but the potatoes were not well prepared.  If you have chicken on the menu, it should be excellent.

I will admit, I have only been once and it could have been an off night, but it wasn't slammed.  The atmosphere is really great, so I would hope that the food would match, but it really didnt.
author: Markus S.

description:
Yay! I really like Per Diem!  I have been here for Happy Hour and then also for lunch twice.  Both times were business lunches.  Asked for upstairs seating for business lunches, otherwise you may end up too cozy downstairs which would be awkward!

We have had the seasonal Heirloom Tomato Salad with an addition of burrata which was delicious but needed a touch more of the Sea Salt and balsamic vinegar.  I have also had the oysters which were delicious.  Last time i had the Cioppino ($18) which is pretty good.  Presented as tomato crab soup with the shellfish, calamari and shrimp.  Would have been nice to have whole crab legs, but it was all very tasty.    Most recently, I have had the dungeoness crab melt and a side of their soup of the day (asparagus potato on the day I went) which was DELICIOUS ($14)!    

Beautiful space upstairs and downstairs.  Interesting and yummy but expensive drinks - but fun for after work as well.  

Our wait staff has always been great!
author: Betty L.

description:
I reserved a table for dinner but we ended up going a hour earlier to their happy hour.  Their happy hour ends at 6pm and the place was already packed by 5pm. From their happy hour menu, we started with some drinks, white wine and tequila cocktail. For the food, we ordered half dozen oyster including both eastern and western style. We didn't have table for happy hour on the first ground, but the waiter let us eat our oyster plate by the counter table where they bring the food in and out which is very nice of them! However, I'm not too impressed by their drinks. We also ordered the flat bread pizza on the hh menu only $5 - its a good deal for the size~

After 6pm, we get to sit at our reserved table for dinner on the second floor. They have really classic decoration and chairs. There is also a small but cute patio where some people can stand and sit. We love the ambiance overall. 

We were almost full from the happy hour food, so we only ordered couple dish on their dinner menu:

1. Fritto Misto - it's a fried mix seafood with calamari, oyster and shrimp, we all love this  appetizer, good size for 4 ppls to share.
2. Papparadelle - it's a vegetarian pasta with pistacho pasto. Its tasty!
3. Asparagus as side dish
4. Chocolate - it's a chocolate roll. We are all impressed by this dessert. It's not as sweet as a normal chocolate dessert. Highly recommend this one!
5. We also order a bottle of Riesling wine. Its kind of dry and not sweet, not as good as we expected.

Overall, it's a nice place to go. We will definitely go back again for their food.
author: Julie H.

description:
Dark restaurant with super fun decor.  We tried the gigante meatball and it was exactly what it claimed to be - a big meatball in a bowl (nice appetizer).  We also tried the special - swordfish with polenta, arugula and cremini mushrooms.  I thought this was fantastic.  The shrimp orecchiette which was ok, but seemed much more 'fishy' than I think it needed to be.

Wine seemed pretty overpriced - saw a Chalone pinot noir that I usually see at Safeway for $16 for $48 on the menu.  Was a bit surprised to see this bottle on the menu at all.
author: Janelle C.

description:
It is pretty good lunch place. Not too pricey, yet nice to sit down and have a good conversation instead being rush at your regular lunch cafe.

Portion is big here, and the food while not amazing, it satisfiy one's hungry stomach. Service is pretty good here.

The decor is a bit caters towards lawyer and the likes, but I find it okay to escape the hispter and anti-establishment trend once a while.
author: Alice C.

description:
Ambience: Trendy. Why yes, Yelp you are spot on. This place was trendy and tucked in the FiDi. I feel trendier just by saying "FiDi" even though I'm just a wannabe San Franciscan.

Tried the Funghi pizette (appetizer, split) and the Papparadelle (entree). Was full of carby, vegetarian goodness and I remember being pleasantly satisfied by the lot of it especially at the affordable price.

Dinner conversation wandered, but we did notice that on the second floor, there is a dartboard strangely placed very, very high up- almost touching the ceiling. Clearly no one could throw any darts to reach it, making it have no useful purpose. We deemed it "art" and moved on in our lovely meal.
author: Aditi J.

description:
Delicious California Italian cuisine.
