description: I got to check this place out early and it's amazing.  The attention to detail in this place is incredible.  It's the Brickyard guys at it again and it's obvious to me that it's going to be a huge hit.  Serving food and alcohol for the FiDi crowd during  happy hour in the "NoMa"... a much needed spot in a neglected area.
author: Dan S.

description: This place was great. The atmosphere was awesome. Loved the fact that the dining room and the bar were separate. Classy move. And the food... Great!  Best part, wasn't overwhelmed with a ridiculous amount menu items. I'll be back for sure.
author: Miles J.

description: VERY REASONABLY PRICED great Italian food... the Ciopino was as good as I've ever had... excellent Buratta Brusccheta...advised that the menu is in "start up mode and will be expanding "daily"...Decor is eclectically homey...sensational bar... this place is destined to be THE magnet in the financial district...
author: Stan B.

description: I recently had a nice lunch at Per Diem with my co-workers, and overall I enjoyed the experience.  The decor/ambience of the restaurant is rather impressive and interesting, and probably was the most memorable part of the experience.  We shared a burrata cheese appetizer which was drizzled with honey and shaved almonds, and this was probably the most memorable and delicious of the food items- something I would surely order again.  My coworkers consumed a crab melt sandwich, and a pasta dish with a meat sauce (buccatini?), while I had a margherita chicken sandwich.  My coworkers seemed to generally enjoy their items, and I enjoyed my chicken sandwich, but it was a little dry and bland, missing some sort of intangible to make it 'great'- thus it was not so special that I would insist on ordering it again.  The side salad accompanying it was rather bland and flavorless too, so I would steer away from that in favor of some other side.  Service was prompt and attentive.  All in all, I will probably return when in the area, but based upon my first impression, this restaurant has not earned my unconditional loyalty in this neighborhood- yet.
author: Andy S.

description: Good lunch place at the FIDI. Everything we ordered - mussels appetizer, crab melt & bucatini are great. Flavorful and not too salty.
author: Prascilla L.

description: Good spot without the crowd. Order the bone marrow.
author: Tina N.

description: We sat upstairs. The place has a cool vibe-- The decor is amusing and whimsical. The food was good, tried the frito misto and mussels appetizer, fries and crab dungeness melt. The service left something to be desired.
author: Amy S.

description:
I had my first experience at lunch today. The food was good but service left a lot to be desired. 
We were a party of six and were seated immediately while we waited for the last person to join us. While we were waiting (ten mins) the server never acknowledged us. At least come by and ask us if we wanted to order drinks etc. In fact , we had to hail her down to ask if she was our server (which it turned out she was). During lunch she never came by even once to ask if we needed anything. It made it worse, because we did need few things and again had to hail her down for our requests. 

I don't have a problem tipping a generous 20%, however, it needs to be earned. Since we were a party of six they automatically added the gratuity. I think this system needs to change since all it does is promote bad service to larger groups because gratuity is guaranteed. 

When we complained to the manager all she said was "I will talk to the server". 
That does nothing for me as a patron. 

I choose to opt out of going to that place. There a lot more places in the city and servers that at least make an effort and actually deserve the 20%!
author: aaliya d.

description: I love the way they decorated the place. I usually go here for dinner and hop downstairs to visit Kai at the bar. I have to say I keep coming back for the service and the feel of the place more than anything. They seem to know their wine very well, every server has made great suggestions for pairing with my meal. The bar is stocked with a great selection of whiskey. My only gripe is the happy hour rush, can't really have fun with a bunch of FiDi dudes being obnoxious, but if you're upstairs enjoying their dinner it's a nice place to spend your evening.
author: Jaden M.

description: 3 girls on the first evening of dinner service had it's up and downs but ended on a high note.  We waited forever for our reservation but we were offered a nice glass of bubbly to pass the time.  Then we tried almost every wine they had before settling on the...I forgot, I should have written this review sooner haha.  All in all, the meal was delicious, especially the Buccatini.  The service made up for all of the hiccups.  The best part, they searched high and low and produced dessert for the 3 of us.  They didn't have a dessert menu so they must have run next door.  Awww, aren't those guys nice?  Happy Birthday to us!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
The food here is very good  to ok but the staff has developed serious attitude.  They seem to have forgotten that patrons come to relax and enjoy a drink or meal.  It starts with the hostess who was the worst of the bunch. Hostess wouldn't seat me at our large table till everyone arrived despite it being open.   She suggested I go to the bar where I sat at a large high top by myself only to get hostility from waiter who seemed angry at  my taking the table. 

Another time my friend left her expensive sunglasses. She immediately called and was told by hostess they would hold for her. When she arrived a few days later no had them and once again hostess made her feel like dirt for even expecting them to help.  She sat down for lunch and they didn't offer her anything by way of apology.
author: Dawn S.

description: Diva Nite! Lets cease the day ...... Parking might be bad, location hidden, but the Meatball Gigante was packed with flavor worth revisiting. The "Dividend" cocktail was cool/refreshing it brought out the flavors in the spicy, garlic packed Ciopinno. The breads we tasted were a perfect match to the entree, the toasted bread gave it that nice crunch for texture. While the appetizer bread was soft and delectable. The blackberry sage tea was perfect for a diva, she didn't have to add any extra sugar.
author: Mia B.

description: Fantastic cocktails! And the potato pizzeta is pretty delicious.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great little lunch stop that straddles business casual and urban chic. The vegetables au gratin are smooth, piping hot, and when I went they used zucchini, which maintained its chewiness under a beautiful layer of cheeses. I had their soup as well, which was just OK, but decently priced at 4 something a bowl. Our service was quick and attentive during the crowded lunch hour, and reservations were easy to make on Opentable. Will be back for business lunches again, but a little too pricey for the casual meet-up here and there.
author: Cathy H.

description: Very good.  6 of us went from work.  We all ordered the same dish - Crab Melt.  Beast.  It was great.  Definitely a good spot.  Good food, good environment.
author: Todd S.

description: Very good and convenient lunch spot in downtown San Francisco.
author: Tim H.

description:
i have been here twice (once for goodbye drinks and then again last night for full dinner) and i have to say that both times it was very good.

i had the panzanella salad which was good and then for dinner i had the vegetarian spaghetti which they made for me without the cheese or the butter. (at least that's how i asked for it to be prepared).

my friend had the ceasar salad and the pasta with some kind of meat on it. he said it was all very good but noted it was odd that the ceasar did not have croutons. i'm not sure if that is a mandate for ceasar salads?

other than having to ask the waiter for ice tea three times, the service was great.
author: Kenna T.

description: Per Diem is beautiful; the furniture, fixtures and decor are urban chic and welcoming.  I've been here for a quick drink after work on several occasions and was excited to finally dine here.  Unfortunately, my lunch experience did not meet my expectations.  The baby leaf caesar salad was over-dressed and generally underwhelming.  The frito mixto was very oily and bland.  The service however, was a bright spot.  My waiter was knowledgeable, friendly and attentive.  I'm willing to concede that this may have been an off-day for the kitchen so, I'm willing to give this place another try at some point.
author: Jamie A.

description:
okay, i sorta get the tacking on charges for the SF Health Ordinance (although i've heard there's some sketchy stuff going on with this money in some restaurants....and really, how about just increasing the food prices so we know what we are paying at the end of the dinner?  freaking shady...), but when you start charging for bread, then i feel that you're nickel-and-diming me, which is lame....

anyway, despite Michael Bauer's bad review, i had a nice meal here.  maybe it was the company i was with as well...you know that plays a role, right?  the burrata on toast was pretty tasty....i could eat more of that for sure!  the pear salad with chicories and lardons was excellent.  the halibut special was really yummy (albeit slightly overcooked).  the veggie gratin was so-so.  the panna cotta was okay.

the service was good, although i would have preferred to not have all of the dishes come out at once (which is the opposite of what we were told was going to happen)...they were all nice and attentive though, so it's all good.
author: Miss P.

description:
popped in here randomly on a thursday night and was told that w/o reservations there was a 30 min wait 

left our number and decided to go to starbucks around the corner.

not five minutes later we get a call, your table is ready. cool.

coffee in hand my friend and i decided to try some of their wines before picking one; then the waiter generously filled it near brim :)

the pasta was fresh and the highlight; the burata was good but nothing spectacular.

definitely worth trying out, delicious food for the ticket price plus the service was awesome. for a place as crowded and noisy as it is, he didn't forget to check up on us every now and then. most places you'd only see the waiter 3 times. once when you flag him down to order, when the meal is delivered and again when you flag him down for the check.

not so here.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
Food: The buratta crostoni, salads, zuckerman asparagas pizza with a fresh cracked egg, buccatini pasta, and mix of East and West coast oysters were all amazing. The chef really knows how to build a menu that complements fresh and seasonal ingredients with starchy, comforting, Italian-inspired staples. The intriguing daily catch fish and lasagna specials just make the decision harder. There is something here for everyone, unless you are one of those people who thinks "tastefully seasoned" is synonymous with "bland." If you know better, read: Foodgasm.  Oh, and ask for wine pairings with your food. The Per Diem sommeliers know what the fuck is up.
Service: Our server was knowledgeable, and tons of fun. He had much more personality than you tend to find at hotspots like this at the busiest time of the night. Without being overbearing or ignoring his other tables he interjected every new course with his wit, including a funny anecdote about Aretha Franklin doing shots of lager and eating rhubarb when we told him we were considering doing karaoke later that evening. I'm not really sure if he completely made it up or not, but it totally sold us on the amazing strawberry rhubarb "pie-zetta" with creme fraiche gelato. I'd totally hang out with everybody that works in this place, how many fidi restaurants can boast that?
Drinks: Even though the bar tenders can make just about anything you have your heart set on, Per Diem's cocktails are a must while ingesting such a great meal. At this point I've tried and enjoyed them all, but the Eva Peron and the Wingtip are the bomb dot com.
PS- I noticed someone commented about the eyes of some of the hostesses. Fact: those ladies are beyond gorgeous. But- have you ever gazed into the twinkling blue oceans of Chris Parks eyes? I mean really gazed?  Per Diem is a beautiful place with beautiful people working there.
author: Kat M.

description: Food was okay and service was not much better. Everything seemed bland; very little dressing on salad, dry sandwich. I think I will stick to drinking there as they have that down
author: me m.

description:
I never tip 10%. Today I did. Yes, entirely my fault I mis-ordered the fritta misto, thinking it was a seafood salad. And maybe I should have begged to send it back and reorder. Instead, I told the server/bartender that I had thought I was ordering a salad, and that I hate fried food. She shrugged and said "It's not a salad, it's on the menu as a side dish" and even opened the menu to show me. No offer to exchange it for another item. I didn't eat it, and a while later she removed the plate and slid the check to me without a single comment. In fact, no eye contact or comment from her for the remainder of my time at the bar. 
At least the French press coffee was good.
author: Stacy H.

description:
A chic spot in the FiDi, serves well executed Italian inspired seasonal Californian cuisine by chef Adam Hinojosa ( Osteria & Cafe De Amis).
The two story Loft style space is stunningly decorated with funky salvaged items and an antique chandelier, cement pillars with two impressive bars completed with an enclosed atrium covered with a skylight. 
They take pride in their bar menu hence our drinks were well made. I had the refreshing Divident (10 Cane Rum, Chartreuse Verte, Luxardo Maraschino, and Lime Juice) and my friend had a strong Blood and Sand (Singleton Scotch, Carpano Antica, house infused cherry brandy, orange juice).
We shared the mouth watering Burrata on Crostoni, which was glazed with honey and sprinkled with nuts and the fresh Mussels with sausage. It was uphill from there. At the chef's recommendation we had the Bucatini con pork ragu ala arrabiatta which had a kick to it. The Maple Farms Duck Leg Confit, was rich and perfectly cooked on a bed of some raviolis with mushrooms. Yummy.
For desert, we ordered the chocolate roulade and two glasses of Ben Rye which was perfect paired by Chris, who is the sommelier/manager. 
If you're looking for a cool place for lunch or a dinner in a fun place, Per Diem will serve you delicious food by knowledgeable servers. The bar stays open till 2 a.m. if you wish to simply stop by for their concoctions.
author: Sofie Z.

description: It was a little darker than we prefer, but the music was at the perfect volume and we loved what was being played. Our server was a young woman who seemed to be unhappy. The table next to us was served by a young man who was enthusiastic, funny and accommodating. They were also given bread, which we were not. My wife and I don't drink and this may have set our server's attitude. We would have given this place 1-star if the adjoining table's server hadn't checked on us, heard my wife's disappointment and rushed off to course-correct. 10-min later, as we were signing the check, we were served 2 dessert dishes at no-charge  which were both amazing!
author: Keith K.

description: Anywhere I can get a Pimm's cup off the menu, is ok with me. We only had cocktails, as far as I can remember, all were delicious. I do not remember much else besides liking the drinks and half of the decor. I liked the industrial-ness of it, and disliked the other half. I would come back for more drinks.
author: Carrie G.

description:
My wife and I went here for a date night. This place is perfect for a intimate dinner, however we went here late (9ish) and the lack of a crowd added to the setting. 
Service: Service was excellent. Glasses were always filled and our server was a joy. 
Food: The loss of one star is for the food. It could have been spot on but fell just short. I had the pappardelle with braised brisket. The brocolli rabe complemented the dish very well, however the beets were a couple of minutes under. 
My wife had the Tagliatelle with Arugula pesto. While I found it ok, she found it on the bitter side (she has a much more sensitive palate. If so do you, you might find some of the dishes abrasive). 
Overall, the dishes though lacking just a bit, were definitely good. Service and ambience was excellent.
author: B M.

description: One star for great atmosphere and venue. Very modern. One star for unique and good drinks. Probably a good place for happy hour. That's about it. Food was ok not too great. Oysters didn't taste too fresh but the kicker was the horrible wait staff. I should have listened to the most recent yelpers. I ordered the special salmon and it took about 15 min for the waiter to tell me they were all out. They assumed I would be ok with halibut but I was not. It took him another 10 min for him to get me the menu and another ten min to take my revised order. Even before we finished our apps, the entrees arrived and they gave me halibut. They realized their mistake and as a result, my party was mostly done eating when my meal arrived. Multiple errors there!
author: Wendy W.

description: Went to Per Diem for a work dinner this week and really liked the food - everything was yummy. Especially liked the burratta with honey and toasted nuts and the pasta dish that I had as my entree which had roasted tomatoes and potatoes and pistachio pesto. The service was great and the decor upstairs is pretty cool. It was very empty though, so if you're looking for the scene I would try to go towards the end of the week (thurs or fri). I think I like this place better for dinner rather than drinks, just because the layout downstairs (where the bar is) is a little awkward.
author: Gina C.

description:
Review just for the bar - 
Love the ambiance, great after work spot, great bar tender, and try the home made pickle juice :)
author: Apple P.

description:
This is the place for someone like me. I have not found another establishment that offers similarity in decor, selection of drinks (the alcoholic kind), and good service.   I must have dined here just about a dozen times since its opening and met friends here for drinks/meetings for about the same amount of time.  Granted it gets packed and busy in here, but I prefer that over an empty and quite place where you can hear a pin drop or a mouse fart.  I have noticed that there have been some improvements on some of their dishes and I should only hope that Per Diem continues that (and I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt here).  What I enjoyed most (separating this place from the others in the neighborhood) is that the staff is attentive to our needs and knowledgeable about the restaurant and decorative history.  In any case, they are mostly friendly as some seem a little busy at times.  Keep up the great work and looking forward to seeing you guys for happy hour this Thursday!
*Oh, great work on getting upstairs all finished up! I love the patio.
author: Simon W.

description: My friend and I had a great lunch here.  The dungeness crab melt tasted fresh and flavorful, and the rainbow chard pizzetta was cheesy and delicious.  Service was solid and the ambiance was positive.  A bit dark for a sunny day but overall a very good FiDi lunch spot.
author: melita s.

description: The bar is small and gets crowded but the atmosphere is nice.  We were standing for awhile and pounced on a seat when it became available.  We got the apple cider and the salami plate which were pretty good.  They didn't have bread or crackers to go with the salami and we had to ask for it and it was the hardest and oiliest bread I've ever had.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Lunch today for three. First time at per diem. The decor is pretty amazing considering that this was a former smoothie shop. We ate upstairs, and the where the atmosphere was light, un crowded and homey all at once. 
Led with yesterday's soup, which was white bean chicken. Good, not great. Next we shared burrata on crostini with almonds, sea salt and honey. Creamy, crunchy and sweet and savory.  You would have to hate food to dislike this. The meatball we shared after was tasty, but I have really high standards for meatballs. They should be out of this world if they are on a menu. They were just good. 
Finally, I had the bucatini, served with a wonderful pork ragu. The dish was perfect. Deep flavors that You expect from a lovingly prepared dish that you can imagine cooked for hours. The pasta was perfectly al dente and topped with pecorino. A perfect amount of spice in the sauce. 
Most impressive was the price. Almost shockingly affordable for San Francisco.
author: John B.

description: I met 6 of my friends here last friday.  Cute place, great service, and yummy food.  What more could you ask for? The loft area is open and makes the place so very San Francisco. We all had a blast. I think I might make this place a regular.
author: Faye D.

description: Went here for lunch today and loved it! The decor is stunning and reminded me of the Ace hotel in NY....the food was excellent! We ordered the buccatini and the cioppino and both were delicious. The cioppino had 4 large prawns and a stack of other seafood. The broth was tasty and not at all over powering and the accompanying bread to soak up the broth was welcomed. Great value!
author: Nicole E.

description:
I usually don't give out 5 stars for just anything and while this may not be the most incredible food I've ever eaten, I was seriously impressed, especially for a brand-new restaurant.

We went for a work lunch and initially they made gave us a $500 minimum for our group of 12. Well, as often happens, 4 people couldn't come so we were down to 8 people and were nervous how we would meet the minimum. When we got there and explained the situation, I was expecting the worst, but the host was so laid-back, he wasn't concerned about it and as to be expected, it was easy for them to fill the 4-top after they moved it away from our table.

Work lunches, especially with a group are tough as inevitably people don't have time to sit there for an hour and a half, but some of us got there on time and ordered apps for the table and those came out in good time. We had drinks quickly, our order was promptly taken and we were easily in and out, with a group of 8, in an hour. I was impressed.

We ordered the special anti-pasti plate and that was good, but I have to admit, I was expecting a bigger platter. We also ordered 2 pizettas which were good. I think it's kind of silly they charge for bread service though, but the bread was good.

I ordered the brisket sandwich and it was very good, the meat wasn't piping hot, but it still tasted good and the bread they used was excellent. Good side salad too - you have to order the truffle fries separately. Someone at the other end of the table ordered then but I didn't try.

I love the decor of this place, very cool, staff aren't the least bit stuffy, overall, I was impressed. Like I said, not the most amazing thing I've ever eaten, but very solid food and with everything else that went well, thought it deserved 5 stars.
author: Lauren M.

description: Incredible ambiance, friendly staff and solid food. I recommend Per Diem for a fun happy hour after work.
author: Alex G.

description: Brought a friend here for her birthday.  The service was incredibly slow (took about 20 minutes to get our drinks and they got the order wrong) despite a mostly empty restaurant, and they brought out our entrees before our starters.  The food was alright but did not make up for the terrible service!
author: Liz D.

description: Per Diem has a great selection. Their oysters are delicious, and so is the flat bread. Great for cocktails and appetizers.
author: Sara N.

description:
They charge premium prices for drinks that they pour using a shot glass. Really?  I'm not opposed to paying the premium price but I find it insulting that they are that cheap with the alcohol.

BTW, i'm not talking about "crafted" drinks, I ordered vodka and soda.
author: Kevin K.

description: Went here with a party of four, was seated upstairs and thought it was actually pretty chill. No complaints.
author: Michael T.

description:
Dined here for lunch last week...let me take you through my lunch journey. 

Entered and found myself in a fun, bustling restaurant.  The decor was superb, the people were good looking and the food was fantastic.  Let's start with the decor, old meets new, charming, rustic, all pieces were restored and refinished contributing to the charm that defines San Francisco.   Upon entering I was greeted by the host and hostess.  They were friendly, warm and polite. 

 I was seated upstairs and that's where the food love affair began.  What to order...so many incredible choices.  We started off by ordering a glass of wine, the Chardonnay by the glass was fantastic.  Not to sweet and nice and crisp.  Cooled to the perfect temperature, not too cold.  As we cheered to a great lunch, our appetizer arrived. Burratta...a wonderful cheese on a rustic piece of bread with honey and slivered almonds drizzled on top.  What a great combination of marrying sweet and savory.  I ordered the shrimp louie salad for lunch.  The pickled eggs were delightful, the shrimp on top of the salad were fresh and the dressing was perfect.  I was very happy with my order.  My dining partner ordered the Bucatini.  I did not try it, however he ate every last drop on his plate and oohed and ahhed saying how delicious it was.  I wish we saved room for desert, but we were both so full and will have to be back to try something new as well as the desert. 

To sum up the experience; the decor, staff and food was all top notch.  I will be back and would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great dining experience in the financial district or SF.  

Cheers!
author: T T.

description:
Food was great, I loved the Wedge Salad - best part of my meal.
The service was a tad slow, it's no fun staring at a table full of empty plates for 15 minutes. 
But overall a lovely experience and I'd go back.
author: Robyn S.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner with a friend. Was a little on the expensive side for the food you get.  Service was okay, actually on the more unfriendly side.  Wouldn't really come here again.
author: HJ J.

description: The food was excellent, and service was great. Elizabeth and Vanessa were great staff and I would definitely go again.
author: Arthur K.

description: Awesome place. Love it. I keep going back. Great vibe on each floor. Amazing food. Amazing service.
author: danielle w.

description: The pizza was delish. I really like the atmosphere.  If you come at lunch on a weekday make sure to come early even if you have a reservation.
author: Ashley P.

description: Had a wonderful dinner here last night. Was catching up with an old girlfriend and all we wanted were a few good glasses of wine, a salad, and to be left alone. The waiter could not have been nicer and more patient with us. The decor is beautiful and elegant and I really enjoyed the whole experience. Will definitely be returning with my boyfriend to try more of the food!
author: Pam S.

description:
We were excited to try Per Diem as it has a great website. We were especially excited about the cool decor and that did not disappoint us. It is warm yet modern, Ralph Lauren, yet City chic.
However......the hostesses were not welcoming at all and the food was lack luster.
We may go back just because of the cool decor and architecture of the space and  great bar drinks.
author: Mark M.

description:
It's time to update my review and give Per Diem it's due credit. Upon publishing my first review, I was immediately contacted by Chris, the General Manager, who graciously offered my husband and I a special tasting menu with wine paring. I really was looking forward to trying their food, so we took him up on that offer. 

Saturday, 7/14, we arrived and were seated in the front of the restaurant (I felt a little like we were on display). Chris immediately introduced himself to us, and the chef (Adam) came out to meet us as well. They treated us to a 6 course tasting menu with various samples of Chris' favorite wines (Chris is also the wine manager). To say they went above and beyond is saying it lightly. Chris checked in after every course, Adam even hand delivered a couple courses to us. For dessert, they gave us a "tasting" of gelatos, then came out with SIX scoops on a platter! 

And here's what I'll say about the food: I love that they believe in fresh, local, organic ingredients. Adam served us 2 different cheeses he hand made earlier in the day. We had a honey / cheese bruschetta, heirloom tomato / fresh mozzarella salad, hand made linguini, calamari, a giant veal/lamb/beef meat ball, and gelato. 

Overall, THIS meal was great. But I know that meal is not what one would typically get at this restaurant. So overall, I'll give Per Diem 4 stars. I LOVE the decor, the menu seems interesting, but since it's a newly opened restaurant, I think they really just need to work on figuring out how to run it efficiently. If they can do that, it'll be fabulous. Both saturday's we were there, it wasn't super crowded (chalk it up to being located in the heart of FiDi, with little to no foot traffic.) So if you're looking for a place to eat w/o big crowds, definitely check it out.
author: Kristin S.

description: Loved the food an the wine! The Bucatini with pork ragu was a bit too salty but still delicious. I have been in 2 times for company lunches and the wait staff was very accommodating. I love that they call to confirm reservations a couple days prior, and when you come in they seat you right a way.
author: Christina S.

description: This place was relaxing and cozy at 5pm the 2nd day it was open, but when I went back a few weeks later around 7 it was far too packed, obviously the place is a hit with the FiDi peeps. There's a great wine list- Ive had the Barbera and the Monterray Pinot Noir, both were great and the prices were fair as well considering the portions are generous and it really is great wine. I haven't eaten here, yet, but I'll try to visit again soon!
author: Natalie M.

description: Smaller place. I tried to come here for dinner once but the place was packed. I came back for drinks another night and it was still packed. Great bartender and good drinks. Theres an extra bar up top - also packed.
author: Huy T.

description:
The decor is definitely nice. It was pretty busy when I went with a coworker. It was Friday at 11:30 and we had to sit at the bar because the tables were all reserved, once they open up the 2nd story though, traffic should clear up.

I tried the crab sandwhich which was good (gets soggy quickly though), but they use generous real crab which is always a plus. The side salad was also very fresh and light.

Also tried their margherita pizza which was a good personal size and very tasty. Haven't tried their drinks, but it looks like they have a good menu and plenty of people were drinking wine.
author: Linda J.

description: Pretentious sounding menu items but overall high quality ingredients and good food.  Good service.  If you are upstairs the tables are really close together so don't come here to have any serious or private conversations.  Probably going to come back for happy hour, but never for dinner again.
author: alexandria n.

description: Came here for a special Mother's Day dinner with my mother & sisters. I arrived a little early so the happy hour crowd was winding down but luckily a little table by the front window was available. The hostess & wait staff was very attentive & polite. I had a yummy cocktail as I waited for my group, I think it was called the Land End? I could be wrong, but it was delish. We chose a margherita pizza & the beet salad for starters. Both were perfect. For dinner we all had something different. I had the short ribs which fell of the bone & were to die for!!! My mother had the ciopinno which had the best tasting sauce ever!!! We all couldn't resist dipping our bread into it a few times. Someone else had the salmon which was the special of the night. The flavor was perfection. My niece ordered the lasagne which is made different daily. We made the mistake of not asking what kind of lasagne it was & her dish, although delicious, was not what she expected. Our waitress was phenomenal & the ambiance of this place was perfect. I love how the bar & dining area are on two different floors, makes your dining experience very pleasant. I will definitely return to catch the Happy Hour one day & also to try more of their menu items.
author: Claudia M.

description: Awesome space for a restaurant, really cool decor and vibe.  Went for a business lunch- was a pretty casual and relaxed atmosphere- started with pizzas for the table then each of us had a pasta dish.  The pizzas were yummy and the pasta was fine.  Not earth shattering but pretty yummy anyway!  It's not too expensive for food but the drinks are pricey.  I'd go back but probably only if I wasn't paying for it myself!
author: Ashleigh R.

description: Went here with a friend for a relaxed dinner out.  The burrata is delicious.  A standout!  Fresh, amazing, simple.  I had the fish of the day, which was quite good - perfectly cooked and nicely presented.  We were seated promptly and everything was as it should with with the service. Cocktails are on the heavy side but that was welcome on a chilly night.  I don't quite get the name though...its not pricey so maybe its meant to be cheeky?  Anyhow, a good spot for a cozy dinner.  Lots of people on dates, some larger groups celebrating, etc.  The bar is small so if you don't have a seat its a bit awkward.
author: Lena J.

description: The food was excellent. The lamb sandwich and soup of the day were very tasty. I will definitely come back!
author: Won't B.

description: excellent food. meatball pizza and bucatini were absolutely delicious. the decor and ambience is awesome too. great place for a date, food, or just a few beers. highly recommended!
author: Hooman A.

description: I love this place. The quality of the foods remains consistently excellent and the restaurant is incredibly affordable for the caliber of food. I had a chance to try their "Build Your Own Manhattan" option where you pick your whiskey of choice, your vermouth of choice and even your bitters of choice. This was truly the icing on top to my experience leading to me bumping them to 5 stars. The server knew all the flavor profiles of the different bitters and vermouths and helped steer me in the right direction for building my custom Manhattan. Goes without saying Manhattans are my drink of choice and a customizable one was cocktail heaven. It's probably been said before also - but their burgers are amazeballs. K- back to Per Diem I go, bye!
author: Steven H.

description: Definitely the best happy hour spot in the area. The food is fantastic, cool atmosphere, all the things you'd look for and expect. The thing that really pushes this place over the top is the staff. When I come here for a drink, I don't feel out of place. Everyone is friendly, which is kind of rare around here and it means a lot to me.
author: Kristopher A.

description: Went bc I have a friend that works there but it stood up to everything I was expecting. Definitely excited coming again for lunch & happy hour in the future. Great location right by the Bart!
author: Pam J.

description: Love this place! Great lounge on the 1st floor, and a fantastic restaurant upstairs. Dark wood and brick everywhere. Don't get to flustered about it being crowded after 5, just stand and have a drink like everyone else. Perfect place to meet friends after work. So happy to see a nice place , hopefully it will help clean up the rest of the area.
author: Amanda P.

description: was fresh and flavorful.  We shared dishes to experience the range of classic combinations with a few twists.  This latter made the fireworks!  Every subtle flavor was present and complemented with something new.  It's such a find to have an atmosphere where we can hear our conversations, too.  I'd been here during the day, when it's super crowded with the biz crowd.  Was reluctant to return for the dinner scene, until the New Chef took....leadership!  Yeah, it took that to stabilize.  Now, it goes beyond to fascinate and appreciate.  Get your booty down!
author: Paula H.

description: Nice decor. Food and service are ok.
author: Yung T.

description:
Had lunch here today and it was pretty good. I had the chicken sandwich and side salad. The chicken was delicious but the bottom bun was a little greasy/soggy. Nevertheless, I would definitely order it again. The portion size was nice too, not too much that you feel stuffed, but enough to make it the rest of the day. The menu is fairly small but to me this is a plus, does not take forever to look through and makes deciding easier. The actual composition of the menu is cool too, really thick pages and looks well made. The decor is also really nice, especially the chandelier. 

I had my 6 month old baby with me and they did not have a high chair. I did not really expect them to, being in the financial district and all, but that did make lunch a little more tricky. Thankfully she was agreeable and sat in the corner of the booth looking around. The only other weird thing was that the waiter didn't really smile and seemed a little snotty, but maybe he was having an off day. All in all, I would go back again.
author: C C.

description: Great looking restaurant with excellent food, excellent service and excellent cocktails. And the prices are very reasonable. We went on a Sat. night and it was not noisy at all and it is the kind of place to bring a date. My date loved it!
author: Dave N.

description: Good food, the kitchen was a little slow, but the dude was knowledgeable. I was torn between the oyster po-boy or the dungeness crab melt and told him to choose for me. I wasn't disappointed with the melt, but I thought the accompanying sauce needed more flavor and less mayo. My lunch buddy had the tomato and basil pizza and added broccolini and pancetta - and loved it.
author: Chris M.

description:
So, let me start by saying that I went for Valentines day, which is just about the worst day to judge a restaurant. Also, the Per Diem website and phone people never mentioned that the place would be running a prefix menu for the day. That wouldn't be much of a problem, except that a friend recommended the place and got me excited for a number of dishes on the regular menu. Also, $75 dollar prefix at a place I have never been to is sort of steep...

Strengths:
- Fantastic Service
- Great Entrees, well flavored and presented
- GREAT Cocktails
- Upstairs is great place to take a date
- Cool Atmosphere
- Great Pasta

Weakness: 
- Starters 
- No mention of prefix after talking to 2 people and no mention on website

We sat on the top level which is definitely a deep contrast to the bar portion downstairs, which seems like a great place to hang after work. Our server, a young man with reddish hair, was absolutely fantastic. He gave great tips and was in that perfect space between checking up on us too much and not enough. The drink he recommended (blood and sand) was insanely good and was very happy with my selection. Even the busser was always there to clean the table and swap utensils. 

For starters we had the beef tartar and the citrus crudo. Both dishes were extremly underwhelming, as the tartar was pretty much a hockey puck of raw beef in a bowl with an egg on top and the crudo ("an Italian cuisine, crudo is a raw fish dish dressed with olive oil, sea salt, and citrus juice such as lemon juice and sometimes vinegar") was using citrus and no fish. Both dishes seemed aimed at presentation and not tasting unique. 

The "salad" portion was fantastic, as we had the goat cheese and radicchio salad and the pasta dish. The home made pasta was out of this world good and made me wish that I could have ordered a full size pasta dish as my main entree. The salad had some extremely creamy and tasty goat cheese, something I usually am not a fan of. 

The strongest part of the meal was the entrees, which is always a good thing. My ladys veal was out of this world good and was definitely a 5 star caliber dish. My ahi was solid and the bean under-garnish was really tasty. Portions were perfect too. 

Deserts were really good (fresh fruit roulade and a fig tart) and were a great way to finish the meal. 

This place is close to 5 stars, but the lack of communication and the mediocre starters keep it at a 4 or 4.5. I plan on going back to try the place on a regular evening and eat some of the more traditional italian fare (like some of the hand made pasta which I sampled). This appears to be a great place to eat and drink with friends, or take a date (upstairs). Good stuff Per Diem!
author: Nick B.

description: I wanted to love this place. I really wanted to give it 4 stars, but sorry, only gets 3. Let me start by saying, the place is super cool & cozy  - make sure you ask to be seated upstairs. Overall, the ambiance is great, and the wine list is decent & not super-inflated like most of the city's restaurant, but the food, at least what we ordered was...fair. We started with the pork belly appetizer. We both felt it was over-cooked & very salty. We both had pasta entrees, but husband liked his ( although the bite I had, the noodles were a tad undercooked for my liking). I had the daily special lasagna, which I thought was delish & true 'comfort food' as it came in its over cheese-laden baking dish, all brown on the edges & gooey..yum! But the caesar salad it came with was topped with these weird and again VERY salty fried onions on it. Yuk. I picked them off & tried to salvage some of the salad. The service was very good, and the staff very approachable. So.....will be come here again? For cocktails or lunch, sure. But not sure about dinner...too many other places to try!
author: Jen S.

description:
FIVE stars for service.  Had lunch here on Tues 2/21.  I was 15 minutes early for our reservation and the rest of my party had not yet arrived.  They seated me anyway and served me water and asked if I wanted anything anything else (more than once)!  Our server was courteous, professional and attentive (taller female, blond hair with waivy ponytail).  
The food was good too.  Spacious and bright (which I like) near the entrance; nice atmosphere!!
author: Chris D.

description: I have to say Per Diem is one of my favorite new spots. It is really great to have a solid location downtown.  Atmosphere is amazing, good crowds and whether you go for drinks or a meal, you won't be disappointed. The food is amazing, be sure to try a variety and save room for dessert!  Also, be sure to check out the upstairs - especially the outdoor area.
author: John C.

description: Who snuck style, flavor, class and ambiance into the Financial District?  Per Diem has all of those things and more.  I am so pleased to endorse this restaurant.  Let me break down why I enjoyed my evening at this joint.  First, upon entering, I could see from the decor that this was going to be unique meal.  The rooms are warm and cozy with lots of woods and ornate golden framing as well as chandeliers.  Next was my drink.   I ordered the wingtip, a wonderful spin on an old fashioned that I enjoyed greatly.  The food was a knock out.  I had a green salad and the prosciutto and asparagus pizza, I sampled my girlfriends rainbow chard pizza and also my friends cheese platter.  All three were excellent and decadent.  Finally I was blown away by the service.  Our server Tom was attentive, knowledgeable about the food and made excellent suggestions about food and beverages to be sampled by first time diners.  I find that service can make or break a meal and in this case it made a great meal even better.  I look forward to my next trip out to Per Diem and I highly recommend to others that they give it a shot themselves.
author: Jim S.

description: Came here for lunch with a friend. We beat the fidi lunch crowd. Our waitress was great.
author: BenHur C.

description: The food here was pretty good. The appetizers were awesome. The pork belly with egg and truffle is almost too good to be edible. Man alive was that good. The meatball was good as was the pizza. My main course left a little to be desired. I had the pesto pasta with clams. The sauce was a little over-salted and I felt there were more shells than clams. I would've preferred they put just the clams in the pasta and add a few clams in the shell as decoration. I actually got tired of scooping out pasta sauce and pulling out clams from every shell. I didn't finish the dish because of this. Where I really found this place lacking was in the service. Granted it was a Friday evening during Happy Hour but for at least the first 30 mins after we were seated, we were completely ignored. It was a business dinner, a group of 5 of us so we were sat upstairs (love the decor by the way). After half an hour, our waitress finally took our drink order. It took another 20 mins to get them. After she dropped off our drinks, she left again for another 5 mins before asking us for our appetizers. Took about 13 mins for that. Ok so by this time we're starving and completely devoured the appetizers. When she came back we let her know we were ready to order our entree and instead of taking the order, she says "I'll be right back", WHAT?!?!? Seriously?!?! Took her 15 mins to come back. Finally got our orders and by the end of the meal, were too exhausted to order dessert. After working all day, you kind wanna eat, talk and go home. Now you don't want to feel rushed but you don't want to be ignored either. I think all of us who were seated upstairs for dinner were all neglected for the happy hour customers downstairs as I saw the same group of people at the various tables from the time we were seated til the time we left (at least it wasn't just us). Perhaps adding a separate staff for us upstairs diners would help. I don't think I'll be back here unless I have 5 hours to kill and I'm not starving.
author: Shariyah M.

description: The first time I went to Per Diem was a couple months ago for a birthday lunch. So many reviews said to get the crab melt, so I did. I wasn't impressed. Not much crab, mostly just an expensive greasy grilled cheese sandwich. I would not eat that again, and indeed, warned someone else the second time from getting it. The interior was cute, two floors, nice ambiance. Others got the crab melt, I think a pasta dish, and a pizetta. I came back again for another birthday lunch, and was seated downstairs this time, a little cramped, not as cute as the top floor, still nice. I had the asparagus lemon pizetta. Much better! It was crispy, light and tasty and had an egg right on the top. Often, I don't like asparagus, but it's in season and fresh and tasted very good mixed with the other ingredients. Other people got the chard pizetta, the mushroom pizetta, and the pimento burger. Everyone really enjoyed theirs. I'm glad I came back because the second time erased my meh impression that I'd had the first time. I think my pizetta was about $14, so definitely not a place I'd usually come to for lunch on a workday, but great if you're meeting friends. It's not big enough to share, or for dinner, but a good size for lunch, left me feeling full without feeling gross or weighed down. I haven't tried their dinner.
author: Merredith L.

description: If you want to order a $14 sandwich and pay $8 for a side of fries, then this is your place.  The side of fries would only feed two people at most and even that's pushing it.  I gave it a second star because it's beautifully decorated.
author: Theresa P.

description: Restaurant doesn't know it is in the hospitality business!  From the internet photos of the dining room & the prices we assumed this to be a nice restaurant.  When we arrived we were seated not inn the dining room but at a 3-top by the door in the bar, (the hostess claimed we'd requested this, the worst possibility in the restau.)  It was a cold night and the constant comings & goings froze us near to death.  A man wanted to smoke so he placed his beer on our table.  Food was just okay for what turned out to be pub cuisine.
author: Derek N.

description: Went with a co-worker, great place!  Had the short ribs, soo tender, and a cocktail and a glass of wine.  Great ambiance/decor, and very hard to see it - the town car missed it!  It's a glass window, and the sign is etched in the glass, look out for it!
author: Kim L.

description: Pleasantly surprised.  Great ambiance.  Papardelle had just the right amount of spice.  Pasta was aldente.
author: cin y.

description: It has lovely decor - a nice oasis in the middle of downtown SF.  The menu was extensive and the service was attentive and friendly.  Definitely recommend.
author: Charmaine C.

description: Per Diem is the perfect spot to grab a few drinks after work or have a get-together with friends.  From the vintage, masculine decor, to the chicken with broccolini, to the amazing wine and beers selection, everything is pure perfection.Every now and then, my friends and I will go in on Friday's to start off our evening, and it's never a regrettable decision!  The bartenders, Koy and Scott, really know about their drinks and are always a joy to chat with.  Definitely a place worth visiting!
author: Kelly L.

description: Came here for lunch recently and gave the pappardelle a try.  I have to say I was pretty impressed.  One of the better pappardelle's I've had.  Will definitely be back again for food and drinks!
author: Peter S.

description: I made reservations to try out Per Diem for dinner tonight. I was excited to try this new hot spot in the FiDi and I'm glad I did. The atmosphere of the place was really cool. High ceilings, and a really cool vibe. I came around 6:45 on a Monday, and it wasn't super packed, but I'd still recommend making reservations. I can see this place being quite busy right after work hours. My only complaint about this place is the very small menu. Not that it's much of a complaint because everything on the menu looked exquisite, but I'd like to have a few more options for entrees. I'd definitely recommend this place for a small snack and drinks, but would like a stronger entree menu for dinner in the future. I ordered the Papparadelle pasta which was absolutely delicious. My friend enjoyed her Buccatini very much as well. All of the pasta dishes were between $12-14 with a few heavier entrees between $17-25. They also have a small selection of appetizers and salads. The pasta is made fresh in house and you can definitely taste the quality.  I was very impressed with my dish, and I'd definitely order it again. The dishes all sounded very creative, and I'd like to come back to try more. Service was amazing. I really hope this place does well!
author: Ashley D.

description: Searched for pizza places near union square and I don't know why this place came up. Only a couple choices; $56 for two personal size pizzas. Also music was very loud; like eating pizza at a club. Food was ok, atmosphere decent. Look elsewhere if what you mainly want is pizza.
author: Jay S.

description: The only good thing I can say about this place is that the female bartender makes a great margarita.  We put ourselves on a waiting list for a table in the area by the bar, and the host unfairly (we think), let a man at a table move to a bar stool in exchange for letting the couple at the bar have the table instead.  The man's companions had left and he obviously didn't want to sit at a table alone, but I don't think it was really necessary to cater to his whims.  We spent about 45 minutes (and two drinks each) waiting and finally gave up.  We won't be returning to this place.
author: Elaine T.

description: Delicious and loved the ambiance!  Great work lunch spot!
author: Briana B.

description: I love the interior of this place, I want to live in that space. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. We originally had reservations on a night the restaurant had to be closed (broken water main). They comped us drinks and  an appetizer for the inconvenience. The drinks were fun and we loved the pork belly. I don't often order chicken at a restaurant, but I was glad I did. Mary's chicken was perfect. Will be back!
author: Terri D.

description: Went to Per Diem for a birthday dinner.  Our group had a terrific time.  Seated upstairs.  Good food, our server Dino was great, overall an excellent experience.
author: Meg H.

description: I've had drinks and lunch here.  Friendly staff.  Decent food.  Bar and main floor area kinda sucks.  Not a very good use of the space.  The bar tends to get way too crowded and nearly impossible to stand and have/get a drink.  The restaurant design looks great.  It used to be a salad bar joint.  I would go back for lunch but not for after work drinks.
author: adriana f.

description: Great atmosphere and relaxed environment combine nicely with reasonably priced diverse menu.  Great for lunch!
author: Rick B.

description: Cool eclectic decor (including an antique water heater as a bar tap fixture) in a darkish, cozy spot.  Service is top notch, friendly and attentive without being overbearing.  Pizza is perfectly done with the tangy sauce coating the edges like candy.  Speaking of which, where's the dessert?!
author: Danielle B.

description: Sitting there is sooo nice. The music is great, the decor is fabulous, and the whole atmosphere is great. However, I think their prices are a little too high for their food. Definitely, I will not order the Young Rabbit again. I would recommend Mary's chicken, Bucatini, and the Osso Bucco. The customer service is great! Always attentive and helpful.
author: Jer S.

description: Pretty space,lovely decor, great music, great service.  Margherita pizza was too sweet. Not terrible, but I wouldn't order it again. Pasta was lovely though.
author: Marie P.

description: A fantastic new restaurant in the heart of the Financial District which provides a great atmosphere, beautiful decor and tagliatelli pasta that will make you want to go back for more soon!  Highly recommend.
author: Greg C.

description: Disappointing.  They were sold out of multiple entrees at 6pm on a Tuesday night (they only have a handful of entrees to start with), as well as a side dish.  The carbonara special was more like alfredo and had red peppers in it, not a great combination.  The panna cotta for dessert was almost a liquid consistency.  Truffle fries were underwhelming.  I had high hopes for Per Diem given that they're in the FiDi, but sadly, was disappointed.
author: A K.

description: I had dinner at Per Diem the other evening while on my way to a lecture at the KMPG builing in the Solarium. Upon entering the restaurant, I could tell the dinner experience wasn't going to be great. Anytime the noise level in a restaurant exceeds the ability to talk and be understood you know it can only head down from there and it did. I was seated with my companion at a high table right near the bar. The noise level was ridiculous. I can understand bar banter and the downtown crowd wanting a new watering hole but as a restaurant this place doesn't cut it. We ordered the burrata pizza and the orechiette. The burrata on the pizza wasn't very fresh and clearly either was the dough making up the crust of the pizza. The orechiette, while handmade, wasn't cooked properly. I like my pasta al dente, not like cardboard with a crunch. The water in which it was cooked clearly wasn't salted enough and you could tell the orechiette wasn't finished in a saute pan. It was pulled from the water pot and into the serving bowl. As most of the other reviews highlight, it's great for drinks for the downtown crowd, but for dinner, I wouldn't count on Per Diem for a enjoyable meal. The noise level as stated is ludicrous and the food, which could compensate to some degree, doesn't by any stretch of the imagination. I imagine Per Diem won't have much staying power as a dining experience and probably end up being a  place for the downtown financial crowd to meet for drinks until another watering hole manifests itself and the crowd moves on.
author: Daniel M.

description: i (unwittingly) brought a guest visiting from London for Per Diem's first Saturday dinner service. my friend was a little late and the staff was super understanding and let me wait at the bar. you can tell the bartender was a quality dude & i was impressed by the simple yet thorough cocktail menu. i got a dividend, it was yummy & i will be getting it again for happy hour this Friday. when my friend arrived, he grabbed a beer & we were leisurely seated at a table upstairs. the staff didn't rush us which i appreciated. the decor is really impressive, it almost has a movie set feel to it. we shared a bottle of wine, i had the panzenela with bloomsdale spinach salad and the buccatini pasta, both super delish. my friend had a rabbit dish that i can't find on the menu now, maybe it was the special. he gave me bite & it was heaven on a fork. as we were finishing up, the staff started partying on their beautiful balcony. they were very friendly & if my friend wasn't jetlagged, we would have joined them. all in all, a great new spot for downtown.
author: Rita F.

description: I'm gonna say four stars for now but it's well on it's way to five.  When we got there for lunch today we were a little nervous because when my friend ordered a Bloody Mary they told her that the one thing they don't have is tomato juice.  Whaaat?  But we had a really great Chardonnay (several) and that more than made up for that mistake.  The food was great.  We started with the burrata which was the best I've ever had.  I had the Mary's Chicken--the best downtown--crispy skin and the meat was perfectly moist.  My friend had the pasta with mussels which she said was "divine" and there was an ample enough portion that she had them box it up so she could take it home.  The service is phenomenal!  Ross is the best waiter that I've come across downtown in a long time and one of the best in the city.  After dinner drinks (yes, we enjoyed the place that much) need a bit of work.  They weren't sure what a B&B was and when they made it from scratch, they did a very good job but then they served it chilled, in a martini glass.  So, I'll say food--great; service--excellent, wine selection--top rate, cocktails--work in progress.  I will be back.  Often.
author: M W.
